0.title: Pant smashes fastest Test hundred by an India wicketkeeper, breaks Dhoni's record
0.article_body: Rishabh Pant on Friday smashed the fastest hundred by a Team India wicketkeeper in Test cricket. The 24-year-old set the record by reaching the three-figure mark off 89 deliveries against England in first innings of the rescheduled fifth Test. The previous fastest Test hundred by an India wicketkeeper was hit by MS Dhoni off 93 deliveries against Pakistan in 2006.

1.title: Accused in Kanhaiya killing paid extra money to get '2611' as his motorbike number
1.article_body: Riyaz Akhtari, a prime accused in Udaipur tailor Kanhaiya Lal's beheading, had paid extra money to get '2611' on his bike's registration number, authorities have said. As per reports, the registration number RJ 27 AS 2611 is a reference to 2008 Mumbai terror attacks. The bike has been confiscated and was reportedly used by Akhtari to flee the murder scene.

2.title: Randeep Hooda to hold prayer meet for Sarabjit's sister Dalbir
2.article_body: Actor Randeep Hooda will be holding a prayer meeting for Sarabjit Singh's sister Dalbir Kaur on July 4. He had earlier penned a note for her following her demise due to a heart attack. Randeep had also performed her last rites. The actor had reportedly promised he would give 'kandha' (shoulder) to her mortal remains after her death.

3.title: Surbhi Tiwari files FIR against husband, in-laws over domestic violence
3.article_body: Television actress Surbhi Tiwari has filed an FIR against husband Delhi-based pilot and businessman Praveen Kumar Sinha, his mother and his sisters-in-law for domestic violence. She claimed Praveen was supposed to move to Mumbai but later refused. "I haven't got my stree dhan back...If I had...I wouldn't have to sell my gold ornaments for survival and medical expenses," Surbhi said.

4.title: Briton Watson enters Grand Slam singles 4th round in 43rd try at Wimbledon
4.article_body: World number 121 Heather Watson has entered the fourth round of a Grand Slam in singles for the first time in her career after a 7-6(8-6), 6-2 win over Slovenia's Kaja Juvan at Wimbledon 2022 on Friday. This is the Briton's 43rd Grand Slam tournament over 12 years. Meanwhile, third-seeded Ons Jabeur, the 2021 Wimbledon quarter-finalist, has reached fourth round.

5.title: 5 killed due to lightning in Bihar; CM announces ₹4 lakh ex-gratia
5.article_body: Bihar Chief Minister Nitish Kumar on Friday expressed grief after five people died due to lightning in three districts of the state. The CM further announced ex-gratia of ₹4 lakh for the family members of each of the deceased. He also requested people to take full vigil in bad weather and follow the suggestions issued by the Disaster Management Department.

6.title: Monkeypox cases in Europe have tripled in last 2 weeks: WHO
6.article_body: World Health Organization's (WHO) Europe chief Hans Kluge on Friday said that monkeypox cases in the region have tripled in the last two weeks. Kluge urged countries to do more to ensure the disease does not become entrenched on the continent. Over 5,000 monkeypox cases have been reported from 51 countries worldwide so far, according to a US health agency.

7.title: People must enjoy 'Ms Marvel': Farhan on the length of his role
7.article_body: Speaking about the short length of his role in 'Ms Marvel', actor Farhan Akhtar said that people must enjoy the show and Kamala's journey. Farhan added he's a part of the show due to Asian representation. His character sacrificed himself to protect Kamala. On being asked if his character is really dead, Farhan said, "I'm not allowed to answer it!"

8.title: Vijay Deverakonda meets fan who tattooed his pic, sign on her back
8.article_body: Telugu actor Vijay Deverakonda recently met a female fan who got a portrait of his face as well as his signature tattooed on her back along with a heart. The video which has gone viral on social media shows the fan interacting with the actor and breaking down. Vijay can then be seen hugging and consoling her during their interaction.

9.title: Virat Kohli's reaction after getting out for 11(19) in 5th Test against England goes viral
9.article_body: Former Team India captain Virat Kohli was dismissed for 11 runs off 19 deliveries in the first innings of the rescheduled fifth Test against England on Friday. A video of Kohli's reaction after getting bowled has gone viral. In the video, Kohli can be seen smiling before making his way back to the pavilion. Kohli was dismissed by Matthew Potts.

10.title: Sudhir Chaudhary resigns as Zee News CEO, will start own enterprise
10.article_body: Zee News Editor-in-Chief and CEO Sudhir Chaudhary has resigned from his position. In his resignation letter addressed to Essel Group chairman Subhash Chandra, Chaudhary said his decision was a "result of his internal deliberations" to "start his own enterprise". He also sought blessings from Chandra while parting ways with the company "with heavy heart".

11.title: Steve Jobs, Simone Biles, 15 others to receive US' highest civilian honour
11.article_body: US President Joe Biden has announced 17 recipients of the Presidential Medal of Freedom, the US' highest civilian honour. The award will be presented to Apple's late Co-founder Steve Jobs, four-time Olympic gold medallist Simone Biles, actor Denzel Washington, and Olympic gold medalist soccer player Megan Rapinoe. "These...Americans demonstrate the power of possibilities," the White House said.

12.title: Opening a new chapter in ties with France: Aus after submarine row
12.article_body: During a visit to Paris, Australian PM Anthony Albanese said that Australia and France are opening up a new chapter in their relationship. This comes after tensions between the two countries rose briefly following Australia's cancellation of a deal to buy French-made submarines. "He's not responsible for what happened...We'll speak about the future, not the past," the French President said.

13.title: West Bengal LoP Suvendu Adhikari's convoy hit by speeding truck
13.article_body: West Bengal Leader of Opposition Suvendu Adhikari on Friday said that a heavy vehicle rammed into a Central Reserve Police Force (CRPF) escort car of his convoy. "By the grace of Lord Jagannath, nobody was hurt. I am not injured and will continue attending scheduled events. I am grateful for the innumerous calls enquiring about my well-being," Adhikari added.

14.title: We'll do good job as Opp'n, win back people's trust: Maha NCP chief
14.article_body: Maharashtra NCP chief Jayant Patil said that his party will do a good job as the Opposition and win back people's trust. The three parties of Maha Vikas Aghadi (MVA) will nominate a common candidate for the Assembly Speaker's post, he added. Speaking about ED summons to Sanjay Raut, he said, "He's innocent and we have no doubt about it."

15.title: 2 workers die while cleaning septic tank in Chennai, 2 arrested
15.article_body: Two workers cleaning a septic tank inside a gated community in Chennai's Perungudi died after inhaling poisonous gas on Wednesday evening. The police have arrested the building secretary who's an ex-serviceman and the supervisor in the case. The workers P Periyasamy and D Dhatchanamoorthy, both 38 years old, had been doing such work for the past five years, police said.

16.title: List shows 36 cricketers who have captained India in Test cricket
16.article_body: Jasprit Bumrah on Friday became the 36th cricketer to captain India in Test cricket. As many as 303 players have represented the country in Tests, with 36 of them going on to lead the nation. Cottari Kanakaiya Nayudu was the first captain of Indian Test team. Meanwhile, Virat Kohli holds the record for captaining India in most Tests (68).

17.title: Remove all content justifying Udaipur man's killing: Govt to social media platforms
17.article_body: The Ministry of Electronics and Information Technology has directed social media platforms to immediately remove all content that "seem to encourage/glorify/justify" the beheading of Udaipur man Kanhaiya Lal. This is to prevent any incitement and disruption of public order and to restore public peace and harmony, the Ministry said. Meta said it has designated the incident as "violating".

18.title: I thought he'd get to T20 WC 2022: Buttler on Morgan's retirement
18.article_body: Commenting on ex-England limited-overs captain Eoin Morgan's retirement from international cricket, Jos Buttler said he thought Morgan would play T20 World Cup 2022. "Thought that was what he was working towards, but he's always said...if he felt like the time came and he obviously said that that came in Amsterdam," he added. Buttler was appointed as England's new white-ball skipper.

19.title: Udaipur incident shows Taliban mentality: Haryana Home Minister
19.article_body: Haryana's Home Minister Anil Vij has said that Kanhaiya Lal's killing shows a "Taliban mentality" and that it needs to be eradicated from India. He added, "We'll take all necessary steps to tackle such a mentality." Two more people have been arrested in connection with the case for their alleged involvement in hatching the conspiracy, IG Udaipur said on Friday.

20.title: Punjab households to get 300 units of free electricity from today: CM Mann
20.article_body: Punjab CM Bhagwant Mann said households across the state will get 300 units of free electricity each month from today. "This means that people will get zero amount bills. All electricity bills prior to December 31, 2021 will be waived off," Mann further said. AAP chief and Delhi CM Arvind Kejriwal, while congratulating Punjab's citizens, said, "We've fulfilled our promise."

21.title: 'Fluffy' crab that wears a sponge as a hat discovered in Australia, pics released
21.article_body: A new species of crabs, with its body covered in fluff and hair, was discovered off the coast of Western Australia. The species, Lamarckdromia beagle, belongs to the Dromiidae family, commonly known as sponge crabs. Crustaceans in this family fashion and use sea sponges and ascidians for protection. They trim the creatures using their claws and wear them like hats.

22.title: India calls on Pak to release 536 Indian fishermen & 3 civilians
22.article_body: India on Friday called on Pakistan to release and repatriate 536 Indian fishermen and three civilian prisoners. India made the demand as the two countries exchanged lists of fishermen and prisoners today under an agreement. The Ministry of External Affairs (MEA) handed over a list of 309 Pakistani civilian prisoners and 95 fishermen in India's custody to Pakistan.

23.title: Who is SC Justice Surya Kant, who criticised Nupur Sharma for remarks on Prophet?
23.article_body: Supreme Court Justice Surya Kant, who severely criticised Nupur Sharma's remarks on Prophet, was elevated to the apex court in May 2019. He started his law practice in Haryana in 1984 and was appointed as the youngest Advocate General of Haryana in July 2000. Kant is on the bench for important cases like Article 370, Pegasus spyware, CAA etc.

24.title: Over 10 injured as roof of cabin collapses on Guj Rath Yatra route
24.article_body: Around 10-15 people sustained injuries when the roof of a cabin they were sitting on caved in on the route of Jagannath Rath Yatra in Gujarat's Ahmedabad on Friday. Minister of State for Home Harsh Sanghavi was reportedly walking along with the procession when the incident took place. "Policemen rushed to the spot and helped all of them," Sanghavi said.

25.title: Raj Thackeray hails Fadnavis for accepting Maha's Deputy CM's post
25.article_body: MNS chief Raj Thackeray on Friday congratulated Devendra Fadnavis on becoming Maharashtra's Deputy CM. "Everyone thought...you'll become CM, but sometimes one has to accept party's instructions," he wrote in a letter to Fadnavis. "Party's order is greater than anyone's ambition, you have shown it from your actions. This should be remembered by every political party worker and leader," he added.

26.title: We need to work on partnerships: Harmanpreet on India Women's 1st ODI win
26.article_body: Following India Women's four-wicket win against Sri Lanka Women in first ODI, India captain Harmanpreet Kaur said the team needs to work on partnerships. Harmanpreet Kaur(44) and Harleen Deol(34) added a 62-run partnership for the fourth wicket. Deepti(22*) put on an unbeaten 38-run seventh-wicket stand with Pooja Vastrakar(21*) to help chase the 172-run target with 12 overs to spare.

27.title: Maoist carrying ₹5 lakh reward killed in encounter in Chhattisgarh
27.article_body: Police said that a Maoist carrying a reward of ₹5 lakh on his head was killed in an encounter with jawans of the District Reserve Guard (DRG) in Chhattisgarh's Sukma on Friday. "After the encounter ended, we recovered the body of a male Maoist...initially identified as Kamlesh, Malenger Area Committee Member," Sundarraj P, IG Bastar range, said.

28.title: England announce squads for their T20I and ODI series against India
28.article_body: England have announced their squads for the upcoming T20I and ODI series against India. The T20I and ODI series will be the first for Jos Buttler as England's full-time white-ball captain. Lancashire's 34-year-old fast bowler Richard Gleeson has earned his first full England call-up for the T20I series. Ex-England captain Joe Root has been included in the ODI squad.

29.title: Former DE Shaw partner fired for sexual misconduct wins record $52 million in US
29.article_body: A former partner at American hedge fund DE Shaw, who was fired at the start of the #MeToo movement in 2018, has been awarded record $52 million by an arbitration panel in the US. Daniel Michalow had filed a defamation complaint against DE Shaw seeking $600 million in damages. The panel also found that Michalow "did not commit sexual misconduct".

30.title: Received death threat from Sidhu Moosewala's murderers: Manu Punjabi
30.article_body: 'Bigg Boss 10' contestant Manu Punjabi has claimed that he received a death threat from the gang that murdered Punjabi singer and Congress leader Sidhu Moosewala. He took to Twitter to thank Jaipur Police for giving him security and catching hold of the culprit who sent him the email demanding ₹10 lakh. Manu also posted a screenshot of the email.

31.title: 1 in 5 houses in Bengal faced food crisis during lockdown: Report
31.article_body: A report released by Nobel laureate Amartya Sen-led Pratichi (India) Trust said that at least one in every five households in West Bengal faced "some food crisis" during the lockdown period in the first wave of COVID-19. "A majority of these households suffered for about 60 days," it added. Over 2,000 households had participated in the survey, the report mentioned.

32.title: Over 50 hurt as KSRTC, pvt bus crash against each other in K'taka
32.article_body: More than 50 passengers were left injured after a private bus and a Karnataka State Road Transport Corporation (KSRTC) bus crashed against each other on the Shivamogga-Sringeri road. As per reports, there were more than 35 passengers on the private bus and over 45 passengers on the KSRTC bus.

33.title: 5 terrorists arrested in Srinagar & Sopore, arms cache recovered
33.article_body: A hybrid terrorist was arrested on Thursday in Srinagar with a pistol, police said. Upon interrogating him, another hybrid terrorist was nabbed from Pampore with three pistols, police added. A grenade, bullets, gelatin sticks and detonators were also recovered from the duo, as per police. In Sopore, police said three terrorists were intercepted with an assault rifle, grenade and pistols.

34.title: I am the one who started the pan-India films trend: Madhavan
34.article_body: Actor R Madhavan has stated that he is the one who started the trend of pan-India films, adding that the rest of the world is catching up to him. "'Ramji Londonwaley' or '13B', which was one of the first films to be shot simultaneously, 'Rocketry' has the distinction of being shot in three languages, forget about two," the actor added.

35.title: A nothing shot: Shastri on Gill's dismissal at 17 in 5th Test vs England
35.article_body: Reacting to Shubman Gill's dismissal at 17 in fifth Test against England in Edgbaston, Ravi Shastri said it's unfortunate and the India opener needed to bring discipline into his game. On a James Anderson delivery, Gill was caught by Zak Crawley at the second slip. "That's a nothing shot...he'll be disappointed with it. This is a boundary-scoring ground," he added.

36.title: Taking extra care: Nadal after 3 players pulled out of Wimbledon due to COVID
36.article_body: Second seed Rafael Nadal said he is taking extra precautions and not doing many things after three COVID positive men's singles players withdrew from Wimbledon 2022. "Just staying here and staying in the house, not going out at all anymore," he added. Nadal, who won his 22nd Grand Slam last month, entered the third round on Thursday.

37.title: Rahul visits vandalised Wayanad office, calls act 'unfortunate'
37.article_body: Congress MP Rahul Gandhi on Friday visited his office in Kerala's Wayanad, which was allegedly vandalised by CPI(M)'s student wing Students' Federation of India (SFI) last week. Gandhi said, "It's unfortunate what happened. Violence never resolves problems." "I don't have any anger or hostility towards them. They are kids and they don't understand the consequences of their act," he added.

38.title: 78-yr-old woman told to pay ₹25,000/month alimony to 83-yr-old ex-husband in Pune
38.article_body: A Pune family court told a 78-year-old woman to pay interim alimony of ₹25,000 per month to her 83-year-old estranged husband. The husband had filed for divorce from his wife of 55 years in 2019 and sought alimony alleging that he was repeatedly harassed by her. The couple also reportedly accused each other of having extramarital affairs.

39.title: HDFC yet to recover funds after sending ₹1,000 cr to some accounts due to glitch: Report
39.article_body: HDFC Bank is still attempting to recover funds from some customers in Tamil Nadu after it mistakenly transferred ₹1,000 crore into their accounts in May, BQ Prime reported. About ₹35-40 crore continues to remain with customers, the report said. The transfer of funds was caused due to a technical glitch, following which HDFC briefly froze many of these bank accounts.

40.title: US fails to secure release of Americans imprisoned in Venezuela
40.article_body: A delegation led by US Special Envoy for Hostage Affairs, Roger Carstens, on Thursday failed to secure the release of American citizens imprisoned in Venezuela, US officials informed. "The trip focused on...wrongfully detained U.S. nationals in Venezuela and to press for their release," the State Department stated. The department added that Carstens met the detainees to "assess their well-being".

41.title: What is earthshine, the phenomenon that will make the Moon glow this weekend?
41.article_body: A new Moon occurs when all of Sun's light is reflected away from Earth, and the side of Moon facing Earth is barely visible. Sometimes the dark face of Moon catches Earth's reflected glow and returns that light. This phenomenon is called earthshine. The earthshine Moon will be visible for next few days but will be brightest over the weekend.

42.title: 14 mobile forensic labs launched by Tamil Nadu CM MK Stalin
42.article_body: Tamil Nadu CM MK Stalin launched 14 mobile forensic labs in Chennai to facilitate preliminary examination at the scene of the crime. The mobile vans have been custom-built at an estimated cost of ₹3.92 crore. Stalin also lauded the Forensic Sciences Department for getting the National Accreditation Board for Testing and Calibration Laboratories international certification for its main lab.

43.title: Congrats on car, but tomorrow isn't 'kol': Anirban criticises Kartik's Bengali
43.article_body: Actor Anirban Bhattacharya recently criticised actor Kartik Aaryan's Bengali accent in 'Bhool Bhulaiyaa 2' on social media. He tweeted, "Congratulations [on] your new car/Chinese food table. Just remember 'tomorrow' is not 'kol' or 'call' in bangla. It's 'kaal'." Kartik was recently gifted a McLaren GT worth ₹3.73 crore by 'Bhool Bhulaiyaa 2' producer Bhushan Kumar following the film's success.

44.title: 60-yr-old Mysore University staffer found dead on day of retirement
44.article_body: A 60-year-old employee of the University of Mysore in Karnataka was found dead with his throat slit on the day of his retirement, police said. "We are investigating the case and so far, we have no information on the killers," DCP (Crime) Geetha Prasanna said. The deceased was a resident of Kanakagiri in the city, police added.

45.title: Sidhu Moosewala, Lata Mangeshkar among top 5 most Googled Asians
45.article_body: Google has released its list of most searched Asians worldwide which features late singers Sidhu Moosewala and Lata Mangeshkar at the third and fifth spots respectively. Actresses Katrina Kaif, Alia Bhatt and Priyanka Chopra are seventh, eighth and ninth on the list. Virat Kohli is in the tenth spot and Salman Khan and Shah Rukh Khan are eleventh and twelfth.

46.title: 30,260 kg of spurious cumin seized from a godown in Gujarat's Unjha
46.article_body: The Food and Drugs Control Administration (FDCA) seized 30,260 kg of spurious cumin seeds and raw materials from a godown in Gujarat's Unjha. "The accused used to mix the spurious cumin with the real one...to prevent customers from detecting the presence of the spurious material," FDCA Commissioner said. Unjha is the biggest market and exporting centre for spices.

47.title: Odisha CM Patnaik pulls chariot during Jagannath Rath Yatra in Puri
47.article_body: Odisha Chief Minister Naveen Patnaik participated in the Jagannath Rath Yatra in Puri on Friday. He was also seen pulling the chariot, along with Governor Ganeshi Lal and Union minister Dharmendra Pradhan. CM Patnaik also introduced the Srimandir Heritage Corridor project to curb challenges during the Rath Yatra, according to officials.

48.title: Nadal is one of the greatest players, he always intimidates me: Gauff
48.article_body: World number 12 Coco Gauff has said 22-time Grand Slam champion Rafael Nadal's words mean a lot to her. "Rafa is one of the greatest in this sport, if not the greatest. I see him in...players' area, he's very nice. He always intimidates me because he is Rafa," she added. Meanwhile, the 18-year-old entered Wimbledon 2022 third round on Thursday.

49.title: Kate Winslet's 1st look from Avatar 2 revealed, pic goes viral
49.article_body: Kate Winslet's look as Ronal was exclusively revealed on the cover of the Empire magazine's special Avatar edition. 'Avatar: The Way of Water', the sequel to 'Avatar', has been directed by James Cameron. Speaking about her character, Kate told Empire, "She is deeply loyal and a fearless leader." The film is scheduled to arrive in theatres on December 16, 2022

50.title: Man shares pic of ₹70 bill for 1 tea on Shatabdi Express, officials explain charges
50.article_body: A Shatabdi Express passenger shared a picture of a bill charging him ₹70 (₹20 + ₹50 GST) for a single cup of tea on the train. Railway officials, however, explained that as per a 2018 order, passengers of Rajdhani/Shatabdi/Duronto trains who don't book meals while reserving seats will have to pay a ₹50 service charge per meal.

51.title: It's like all mess went loose: Urmila on judgment over entering politics
51.article_body: Actress Urmila Matondkar spoke about the judgment she faced on entering politics, saying, "It was like all the mess went loose, everything went baloney." She added that being known as a sex symbol, she was expected to be dumb and clueless. Urmila further said the joke was on the journalists who flew down to Mumbai to film her political campaign.

52.title: Bengaluru to have amenities of international standards: K'taka CM
52.article_body: Karnataka Chief Minister Basavaraj Bommai on Friday said, "We have resolved to develop Bengaluru into a city with amenities of international standards and we are committed to make it a reality." "Our government is committed for the comprehensive development of Bengaluru," he added. Bommai blamed the present civic woes of the city on the previous governments.

53.title: Monsoon Session of Parliament to start from July 18
53.article_body: The Monsoon Session of Parliament will begin on July 18 and conclude on August 12, according to a press release by the Lok Sabha Secretariat. The session will have 18 sittings, the secretariat said. Notably, the session usually commences in the third week of July and concludes ahead of Independence Day, according to a report.

54.title: Have 170 MLAs' support, number increasing: Maha CM Shinde ahead of floor test
54.article_body: Maharashtra CM Eknath Shinde on Friday said that the new state government, formed in alliance with the BJP, has the support of 170 MLAs. "The number is increasing. We have a comfortable majority in the Assembly," Shinde added. State Governor Bhagat Singh Koshyari has asked Shinde to prove a majority in the Assembly on July 4.

55.title: I would've supported Droupadi Murmu had BJP informed earlier: WB CM
55.article_body: West Bengal CM Mamata Banerjee has said that she could've considered Droupadi Murmu, the NDA's Presidential candidate, as the consensus candidate had the BJP consulted her over the nomination. "If...BJP had informed us...that they were backing a tribal lady as the Presidential candidate, then we would've supported her," she said. "Murmu is more likely to win the polls," she added.

56.title: WhatsApp banned over 19 lakh Indian accounts in May
56.article_body: WhatsApp banned 19.1 lakh Indian accounts in May 2022, the Meta-owned messaging platform said in its monthly report under the Information Technology (Intermediary Guidelines and Digital Media Ethics Code) Rules, 2021. Between May 1 and May 31, WhatsApp received 528 grievance reports, out of which 303 reports were for ban appeal. It took remedial action against 24 of these reports.

57.title: Mumbai history-sheeter arrested with drugs worth ₹23.5 lakh
57.article_body: The Anti-Narcotics Cell of the Mumbai Police on Wednesday arrested a 32-year-old history-sheeter, Nasir Qureshi and recovered 156 grams of mephedrone worth ₹23.50 lakh. He was arrested during a routine patrol in Kurla. "It's a commercial quantity and hence Qureshi was placed under arrest and charged under the Narcotic Drugs and Psychotropic Substances (NDPS) Act," an ANC officer said.

58.title: 68 more pelican traffic signals set up to make road crossings safer in Hyd
58.article_body: To allow pedestrians to cross roads safely, the Greater Hyderabad Municipal Corporation (GHMC) has set up 68 pelican traffic signals on intersection points near schools, colleges and hospitals. These signals are manually-controlled and pedestrians can get 15 seconds to cross the road by pressing a button on them. GHMC is planning to set up 26 more pelican signals in Hyderabad.

59.title: Vidyut climbs down scaffolding for selfie with construction worker
59.article_body: Actor Vidyut Jammwal on Friday shared a video on Instagram interacting with a construction worker from a balcony who said he is a fan of the actor. Vidyut can be seen praising the worker, saying he does more stunts every day than actors do in films. He then climbed down the scaffolding to click a selfie with the worker.

60.title: India Women defeat SL Women in Harmanpreet's 1st ODI as full-time captain
60.article_body: India Women defeated Sri Lanka Women by four wickets in first ODI in Pallekele on Friday. It was Harmanpreet Kaur's first match as full-time India ODI skipper. Chasing 172, India scored 176/6 in 38 overs, with Harmanpreet top-scoring with 44(63). All-rounder Deepti Sharma scored 22* and took three wickets, while other all-rounder Pooja Vastrakar hit 21* and scalped two wickets.

61.title: Which startups are likely to become unicorns in next 2 years as per Hurun?
61.article_body: Hurun India's 'ASK Private Wealth Hurun India Future Unicorn Index 2022' has identified 51 'gazelles', or startups founded after 2000 that have the potential to become a unicorn in the next two years. Among these, Shiprocket is the most valuable startup, followed by Zepto and Turtlemint. The list also includes startups such as Ather Energy, Ninjacart, Dunzo, Rapido, ClearTax, Gaana.

62.title: Thane man gets 6 yrs in jail for sexually assaulting 9-yr-old girl
62.article_body: A special court in Thane sentenced a man, Ganesh, to six years of rigorous imprisonment for sexually assaulting a nine-year-old girl. The court also imposed a fine of ₹10,000 on him. The incident took place in May 2015, when the girl was playing outside and Ganesh took her to an isolated place and sexually assaulted her, special public prosecutor said.

63.title: Rachakonda Police arrest burglar, gold & cash worth ₹4.6 lakh seized
63.article_body: The Rachakonda Police arrested a 37-year-old habitual inter-state house burglar, identified as Brahmadevi Raja Ganesh alias Rajaiah from his residence in Khairatabad and recovered ₹1 lakh cash from him. The police also seized three tolas of gold ornaments, 22 tolas of silver, two motorcycles and eight mobile phones worth a total of ₹4.65 lakh from him.

64.title: International Criminal Court marks 20th anniversary of establishment
64.article_body: The International Criminal Court (ICC) marked the 20th anniversary of its establishment on Friday. Currently, the ICC has investigations underway in 17 countries, with a majority of them being in Africa. A total of 123 countries are members of the court and accept its jurisdiction, but countries like the US, Russia and China do not.

65.title: Sindhu, Prannoy crash out of Malaysia Open 2022, lose in quarters
65.article_body: Indian shuttler PV Sindhu crashed out in the women's singles quarter-final at Malaysia Open 2022 after losing to second seeded Tai Tzu Ying on Friday. Sindhu, seeded seventh, lost 21-13, 15-21, 13-21 in 53 minutes. In the men's singles quarter-final, seventh seeded Jonatan Christie beat India's HS Prannoy 21-18, 21-16. With this the Indian campaign has ended.

66.title: I'm just trying to take the complexities out of batting: Bairstow
66.article_body: Talking about his aggressive style of play, England batter Jonny Bairstow said, "I'm trying to remain as clear as possible...have no doubts about my ability or the way I'm going about my batting." He added, "I'm just trying to take the complexities out of batting." Bairstow slammed the second-fastest century and fifty for England in Tests against New Zealand recently.

67.title: Will support NDA's Prez candidate Murmu: Shiromani Akali Dal chief
67.article_body: Shiromani Akali Dal (SAD) chief Sukhbir Singh Badal on Friday said, "We have decided to support National Democratic Alliance's (NDA) Presidential candidate Droupadi Murmu." "We will never go with Congress because of the atrocities they have committed on the Sikh community," he further said. "Akali Dal has always supported people from marginalised sections of society," Badal added.

68.title: Plea seeking withdrawal of SC Justice's remarks on Nupur Sharma filed before CJI
68.article_body: A letter petition has been filed before the Chief Justice of India (CJI) NV Ramana, which seeks the withdrawal of Justice Surya Kant's observations on suspended BJP leader Nupur Sharma. Gau Mahasabha leader Ajay Gautam said that Justice Kant's remarks on Sharma should be declared "uncalled for". Justice Kant held Sharma "single-handedly responsible for what is happening in the country".

69.title: You're not just Nupur's PM, how long you'll save her: Owaisi to PM
69.article_body: After the Supreme Court criticised suspended BJP leader Nupur Sharma for her comments on Prophet Muhammad, AIMIM chief Asaduddin Owaisi questioned, "Will [PM Narendra Modi] issue a statement or not?" "You're not just Nupur's PM. You're the PM of the 133 crore-strong India which has nearly 20 crore Muslims. How long will you save her?" he further asked PM Modi.

70.title: 2 more arrested for Kanhaiya Lal's killing, were involved in preparation for crime
70.article_body: Police said that two more men have been arrested in connection to the beheading of Udaipur man Kanhaiya Lal who had supported Nupur Sharma on social media. "They were involved in the conspiracy and preparation behind the entire crime," said Udaipur IG Prafulla Kumar. The two main accused Riyaz Akhtari and Gaus Mohammad were arrested earlier.

71.title: What's included & what's not as 1% TDS on virtual digital assets comes into effect?
71.article_body: The rules governing the imposition of 1% TDS on the transfer of virtual digital assets (VDAs) of more than ₹10,000 has come into effect from today. All cryptocurrencies and NFTs, except tangible asset-backed NFTs, will be subject to TDS deduction. Further, the government has clarified that gift cards or vouchers, mileage points, reward points, and website subscriptions are not VDAs.

72.title: 16 dead so far in Manipur landslide, rescue op for over 50 underway
72.article_body: The death toll due to a landslide, which hit Tupul railway station in Manipur's Noney district, increased to 16 on Friday. "We hope to complete the search and rescue operations within two to three days. The soil is so soft that hardly any movement is possible," CM N Biren Singh said. Search operations are reportedly underway for over 50 people.

73.title: Cameron Diaz to make comeback with Netflix film 'Back In Action'
73.article_body: Actress Cameron Diaz will be making her comeback alongside actor Jamie Foxx in Netflix's upcoming film 'Back In Action'. Notably, the two actors have earlier worked together in 'Any Given Sunday' (1999) and the 'Annie' remake, which released in 2014. 'Back In Action' will be directed by Seth Gordon and the shoot is expected to begin later this year.

74.title: Van Nistelrooy said 'He should be in circus' when Ronaldo didn't pass: Rio
74.article_body: Sharing an anecdote from his stint as a Manchester United player alongside Cristiano Ronaldo, Rio Ferdinand said, "Ronaldo had the ball wide and was doing tricks...[while] Ruud van Nistelrooy was making the run in the box." "Ronaldo didn't pass and Ruud went crazy, screaming...'He should be in the circus'...Ronaldo got...angry - 'Why's he talking to me like that?'" added Rio.

75.title: Miscreants stalking girl for several days chop off her nose in UP
75.article_body: Miscreants allegedly chopped off a minor girl's nose for resisting rape on Thursday in Uttar Pradesh's Kanpur Dehat district, a report said. The miscreants, who barged into the girl's residence and tried to drag her away with them, attacked her with a sharp weapon when she tried to raise an alert. They were reportedly following the girl for many days.

76.title: DRDO carries out maiden flight of unmanned fighter aircraft in K'taka
76.article_body: The Defence Research and Development Organisation (DRDO) on Friday successfully carried out the inaugural flight of the Autonomous Flying Wing Technology Demonstrator from the Aeronautical Test Range in Karnataka's Chitradurga. "This flight marks a major milestone, in terms of proving critical technologies towards the development of future unmanned aircraft," an official statement said.

77.title: Chances of reviving nuclear deal worse after talks with Iran: US Official
77.article_body: A senior US official on Thursday said that the chances of reviving the 2015 Iran nuclear deal are worse after indirect US-Iranian talks in Qatar ended without progress. The official claimed that Iran had made vague demands, reopened settled issues and made requests unrelated to the deal during the talks. The talks were mediated by the European Union (EU).

78.title: Will try to balance films with emotions, but can't do away with action: Vidyut
78.article_body: Actor Vidyut Jammwal has said that he is trying to balance his films with emotions while doing action. Vidyut said that he would love to play different roles as there are a number of emotions that "we as human beings feel". "But since audiences like to see me doing action more...I just can't disappoint them either," the actor added.

79.title: Cong' Genuine Simple Tax turned into Gabbar Singh Tax by BJP: Rahul
79.article_body: Senior Congress leader Rahul Gandhi has criticised the BJP-led Centre on the fifth anniversary of the implementation of the Goods and Services Tax (GST) across India. "Congress' Genuine Simple Tax was turned into Gabbar Singh Tax by BJP...It's a nightmare to do business, especially for MSMEs. Congress will revive business and jobs with GST 2.0," Rahul said.

80.title: We've shown very small part of Nambi's torture in 'Rocketry...': Madhavan
80.article_body: Actor-director R Madhavan has said his film, 'Rocketry: The Nambi Effect', would have become too dark and morbid if he had shown everything that former ISRO scientist Nambi Narayanan went through. "We've actually shown a very small part of his torture and interrogation," he added. Nambi was wrongly accused in 1994 of leaking defence secrets.

81.title: I was paid well but had nothing to do: Upasana on quitting Kapil Sharma Show
81.article_body: Speaking about quitting 'The Kapil Sharma Show', actress Upasana Singh said that she was being paid well but felt like she had nothing to do anymore. "I told Kapil that I'm no longer being challenged. I asked him to either give me the kind of roles that I had when we started or to let me go," the actress added.

82.title: Steve Smith did look annoyed: Khawaja on run-out in 1st Test vs SL
82.article_body: Talking about Steve Smith's run-out in Australia's first innings of the opening Test against Sri Lanka following a mix-up with him, batter Usman Khawaja said, "He did look annoyed." "Looking [into] the past...does not help anyone," added Khawaja. Discussing about the pitch, Khawaja stated, "I was just laughing because of what the balls were doing, everything...was quite funny."

83.title: It wouldn't be right move for Man Utd to let go of Ronaldo: Ex-player
83.article_body: Former Manchester United player Louis Saha has said that it wouldn't be the "right move" for the English football club to let forward Cristiano Ronaldo go from their side. "It could go both ways, no one can guarantee anything apart from Cristiano...It wouldn't be the right move to let Ronaldo go because he's such a big asset," Saha said.

84.title: Netflix briefly crashes after new 'Stranger Things' episodes released, people react
84.article_body: Netflix briefly went down for many users, after a large number of subscribers logged on to stream the new episodes of Stranger Things. Subscribers were greeted by a 'Network Error' message. "I didn't just count down...seconds like it's New Years for Netflix to crash #StrangerThings," a tweet read. "It's been...5 minutes how did we crash Netflix already," another person tweeted.

85.title: Bumrah corrects Butcher's 'Fast bowler has never captained India' remark, video viral
85.article_body: Jasprit Bumrah, who is leading India in the rescheduled fifth Test against England, corrected ex-England cricketer Mark Butcher during the toss after he said that a fast bowler has never captained India. "Well, it has happened before, Kapil Dev was the captain," Bumrah said to which Butcher said, "[He was] all-rounder." Bumrah then replied, "Alright...all-rounder if you say so."

86.title: 'RRR' nominated for Best Picture at Hollywood Critics Association Awards
86.article_body: SS Rajamouli's directorial 'RRR', starring Jr NTR and Ram Charan, has become the first Indian film to get nominated for Best Picture at Hollywood Critics Association (HCA) Awards. The film will be competing with Tom Cruise-starrer 'Top Gun: Maverick', 'Elvis' featuring Austin Butler, Robert Pattinson's 'The Batman' and others. The winners of HCA will be announced on July 1.

87.title: Happy that I got to act in Dunki on merit, not any recommendation: Taapsee
87.article_body: Actress Taapsee Pannu, while talking about featuring opposite Shah Rukh Khan in 'Dunki', said she feels happy to have bagged the role on the basis of merit. "Nobody picked up the phone for a recommendation. I got the film only because someone liked what I did," Taapsee added. Helmed by Rajkumar Hirani, 'Dunki' is expected to release in December 2023.

88.title: Great gift to planet: Denmark envoy as India bans single-use plastic
88.article_body: Freddy Svane, Denmark's Ambassador to India, on Friday congratulated India for banning single-use plastic items in the country. He said, "I think it's a great idea. India is moving fast. And what India contributes by banning single-use plastic is a great gift to this planet." Notably, the ban on single-use plastic items in India has come into effect from today.

89.title: PM Modi speaks with Putin, reiterates call for dialogue on Ukraine conflict
89.article_body: PM Narendra Modi on Friday spoke with Russian President Vladimir Putin on the phone, the Prime Minister's office said. "In the context of the ongoing situation in Ukraine, PM reiterated India's long-standing position in favour of dialogue and diplomacy," said the PMO. The two leaders exchanged ideas on increasing bilateral trade in agricultural goods, fertilizers and pharma products, it added.

90.title: Don't toy with Mumbai's environment: Uddhav on Shinde govt's Aarey shed plan
90.article_body: Former Maharashtra CM Uddhav Thackeray on Friday said he is saddened by the Eknath Shinde-led government's move to relocate Metro 3 car shed to Mumbai's Aarey Milk colony. "Don't toy with the environment of Mumbai," the former CM added. "Don't project anger for me on Mumbaikars. Don't change the proposal for the metro shed," Thackeray further said.

91.title: He doesn't define me anymore: Kubbra on being sexually abused at 17
91.article_body: Actress Kubbra Sait has stated that she did not write about being sexually abused at the age of 17 by a family friend for an apology from him. "I was not writing to showcase a monster...I am over it. He does not define me anymore," she added. The actress further said she is looking at it from an outsider's perspective.

92.title: Semi-automated offside technology approved for WC 2022: FIFA
92.article_body: Football's apex body, FIFA, has approved the use of semi-automated offside technology for this year's FIFA World Cup in Qatar. The technology aims to make more accurate and a lot quicker decisions, and will be able to resolve contentious offside calls, officials said. Notably, the technology will be assisted with strategically positioned cameras and a chip in the match ball.

93.title: Russia arrests scientist for working with Chinese secret services
93.article_body: Russia has detained a scientist in Serbia on charges of high treason for allegedly collaborating with Chinese security services, the Russian state news agency TASS reported on Friday. Dmitry Kolker has now been moved to a prison in Moscow, TASS quoted Kolker's son as saying. The scientist faces up to 20 years in jail if convicted.

94.title: Neeraj Chopra touches elderly fan's feet after breaking national record, video goes viral
94.article_body: A video has gone viral showing India's Olympic gold medal-winning javelin thrower Neeraj Chopra touching an elderly fan's feet after breaking his own national record at Stockholm Diamond League. In the video, the 24-year-old was seen interacting with fans and before leaving, he touched an elderly fan's feet. One of the fans was heard saying, "So down to earth."

95.title: We were pretty scared, Shastri wasn't able to talk properly: Ishant on COVID-19 outbreak
95.article_body: Talking about COVID-19 outbreak hitting Team India during the Test series against England last year, Ishant Sharma said, "We all were pretty scared during that time." He added, "During the Oval Test...Ravi bhai was in the dressing room and he was not able to talk properly." Ishant stated, "There was his book launch and we thought he had caught cold."

96.title: If SRK had done KGF, audience would have never accepted it: Raj Saluja
96.article_body: Actor-writer Raj Saluja, when asked about the rise of pan-India movies and if Bollywood is going wrong somewhere, said, "It's...audience that decides whom to accept and whom not to accept." "If you put, Shah Rukh in KGF, they'll not accept...[he] can do this. But if Yash is doing it, you're accepting...Why? Because...audience is...accepting...South actors can do...any damn thing," he added.

97.title: Fake call centre busted in Gurugram, 9 held over extorting money
97.article_body: Police on Thursday busted a fake call centre operating from a building in Gurugram's DLF Phase 2 and arrested nine people for allegedly extorting money from foreign nationals after posing as federal police officials. "The accused threatened to suspend the 'national identity number' of potential victims," police said. "They forced them to purchase gift cards of several companies," police added.

98.title: PM Modi congratulates Yair Lapid for assuming Premiership of Israel
98.article_body: PM Narendra Modi on Friday congratulated Yair Lapid for assuming the Premiership of Israel. "I look forward to continue furthering our strategic partnership as we celebrate 30 years of full diplomatic relations," PM Modi tweeted. Lapid took over as caretaker PM after the Israeli Parliament voted to dissolve itself on Thursday, setting the stage for a fresh election in November.

99.title: I had an abortion after a one-night stand when I was 30: Actress Kubbra Sait
99.article_body: Actress Kubbra Sait has revealed she had an abortion after a one-night stand when she was 30. She recalled her trip to Andaman in 2013 when she got physically close with a friend and got pregnant. "I don't think I'm still ready. I don't understand this pressure around women to...[marry]...at 23 and have children by...30," she said in an interview.

100.title: Rupee relatively better placed than other global currencies against US dollar: FM
100.article_body: Amid a declining rupee against the US dollar, Finance Minister Nirmala Sitharaman said that the Indian currency is relatively better placed than other global currencies against the US dollar. Sitharaman said that she is "watchful and mindful" of the impact of the falling rupee and added, "We aren't alone in this world...developments happening everywhere will have an impact on us."

101.title: Russia scraps all COVID-19 restrictions amid declining cases
101.article_body: Russia on Friday said it was ending all COVID-19 restrictions, including the requirement to wear face masks, amid declining virus cases in the country. Russia's consumer protection watchdog, Rospotrebnadzor, claimed that 93% of currently confirmed cases are either mild or asymptomatic. The country has reported more than 1.8 crore COVID-19 cases and over 3.7 lakh coronavirus-related deaths so far.

102.title: Ukraine calls Russia a 'terrorist country' as 19 including 2 kids killed in missile strike
102.article_body: Russian missile attacks on residential areas in a coastal town near the Ukrainian port city of Odesa killed at least 19 people including two kids. Andriy Yermak, the chief of staff to Ukrainian President Volodymyr Zelenskyy said, "A terrorist country is killing our people. In response to defeats on the battlefield, they fight civilians."

103.title: Pune authority demolishes illegal constructions located at Kesnand
103.article_body: Continuing its drive against illegal constructions, the Pune Metropolitan Region Development Authority (PMRDA) on Thursday demolished nine illegal constructions located at Kesnand with the help of five earth movers. According to a PMRDA official, the authority had issued notices to the owners of these properties before the demolition. PMRDA also urged citizens to not conduct illegal constructions.

104.title: ED arrests 2 aides of Delhi minister Satyendar Jain in money laundering case
104.article_body: The Enforcement Directorate has arrested two associates of arrested Delhi Minister Satyendar Jain in an alleged money laundering case, ANI reported citing sources. The duo, identified as Ankush Jain and Vaibhav Jain, are directors of a Delhi-based jewellery firm and they'll be produced in a special ED court later. This comes a month after ED arrested Jain in the case.

105.title: India's space industry has potential to hit $40 bn: IN-SPACe Chairman
105.article_body: IN-SPACe Chairman Pawan Kumar Goenka has said that India's space industry has the potential to reach $40 billion, but investments are a "major challenge". "This is where Indian startups have a disadvantage compared to the US," he said. He also said India can be the global manufacturing hub of several space objects and even "launch satellites for other countries".

106.title: Truck hits e-rickshaw in UP's Sultanpur; 5 killed, 3 injured
106.article_body: An e-rickshaw was hit by a truck on the Prayagraj-Ayodhya bypass in Uttar Pradesh's Sultanpur district. The accident led to the death of five occupants of the e-rickshaw while three people are critically injured. Four out of the five deceased have been identified as Phool Kali (60), Rajendra (45), Raghuvir (55) and Nirmala (52), police said.

107.title: Blast reported inside civil court in Patna; 1 constable injured
107.article_body: A low-intensity blast was reported inside the civil court in Bihar's Patna on Friday. Patna SSP said a constable has sustained an injury in his right hand. According to police, the blast took place when gunpowder, which was recovered from a hostel in Patna University a few days ago, was taken to the court to seek permission for further investigation.

108.title: Directors now think of me for non-stereotypical roles: Mukti on 'Thar'
108.article_body: Actor and dancer Mukti Mohan, while talking about her recently released film 'Thar', said she is glad that she isn't getting the girl-next-door kind of roles. "Now, directors are thinking of me for roles that are non-stereotypical. It's a true blessing that people are noticing me and saying that I can act," she added. 'Thar' also stars Harsh Varrdhan Kapoor.

109.title: He's his own competition: Gautam on Neeraj breaking his national record again
109.article_body: Reacting to javelin thrower Neeraj Chopra winning a silver medal at Stockholm Diamond League after breaking his national record again, Gautam Gambhir tweeted, "This guy is unstoppable. He is his own competition!" Virender Sehwag said, "We will make, we will break...what a return from the champion." The 24-year-old threw 89.94 metres, breaking his previous national record of 89.30 metres.

110.title: Assam CM Sarma sues Delhi Deputy CM Sisodia for defamation over corruption claims
110.article_body: Assam CM Himanta Biswa Sarma has filed a defamation case against Delhi Deputy CM Manish Sisodia after the latter accused the former of "brazen corruption". Sisodia had alleged that the Assam government gave contracts to firms linked to Sarma's family to supply PPE kits at exorbitant prices. Sarma's wife Riniki has already filed a ₹100 crore defamation case against Sisodia.

111.title: TikTok users share credit card info of judges who reversed abortion ruling in US
111.article_body: Several TikTok users are sharing purported personal information such as the credit card details of the judges of the US Supreme Court who reversed the abortion ruling in Roe vs Wade. Such videos are being shared in form of slideshows of the justice's portraits along with the information. Other videos on TikTok allegedly included the home addresses of the judges.

112.title: It was incredible: Ms Marvel's Aramis Knight on working with Farhan Akhtar
112.article_body: Actor Aramis Knight has said that working with Farhan Akhtar in Marvel Studios' 'Ms Marvel' was incredible. "Such a nice guy, so full of warmth. I was able to get quite a few pieces of advice from him that I will always cherish. And overall it was great," he added. Farhan plays a character named Waleed on the show.

113.title: Hero MotoCorp gets permit to use 'Hero' trademark for its EVs
113.article_body: A Delhi High Court-appointed arbitration panel has permitted Hero MotoCorp to manufacture and sell EVs under the trademark 'Hero'. It dismissed the application filed by Hero Electric for an interim injunction against Hero MotoCorp using the 'Hero' brand for EVs. The tribunal emphasised our ₹7,000-crore expenses on the brand building of Hero in the past 10 years, Hero MotoCorp said.

114.title: Was performing badly, Bhatt broke inhibitions publicly attacking me: Sushmita
114.article_body: Sushmita Sen recalled an incident between her and director Mahesh Bhatt on sets of her debut film 'Dastak'. She said she was performing the mahurat shot badly, adding, "[Mahesh]...broke inhibitions in front of 40 media people, 20 production guys, publicly attacking me." "I got...angry and started walking off...he grabbed my hand...and said, 'That's anger, give it (on camera)'," she added.

115.title: Ex-students of DU register for 'centenary chance' to get degrees
115.article_body: Over 8,000 former students of Delhi University have registered for the university's 'centenary chance' examinations, a second opportunity to complete their degrees. Ex-students who were in the final year of their UG, PG or professional courses will reportedly be considered for these examinations. The 'centenary chance' will be offered for theory and practical exams but not for internal assessment.

116.title: Picking Bumrah as captain can cause confusion: Giles on 5th Test
116.article_body: Ex-England spinner Ashley Giles said Jasprit Bumrah being picked as India's captain for the fifth rescheduled Test against England can cause "confusion" in Bumrah's mind regarding when and how much to bowl. "That is why we...don't see pacers captaining international teams in Test matches that much particularly in recent times," added Giles. Giles stated Bumrah is India's "most potent" bowler.

117.title: Pakistani drone airdrops 3.5 kg heroin in Punjab; recovered
117.article_body: Following a joint search operation, the police and BSF recovered 3.5 kg of heroin which was allegedly airdropped by a Pakistani drone in Ferozepur on Thursday. The BSF personnel had noticed the drone and fired at it, but it managed to return to Pakistan after dropping the material, the district SSP Charanjit Singh said. A case has been registered.

118.title: Police save 40-year-old man attempting to die by suicide in Delhi
118.article_body: Delhi Police personnel on Thursday saved a 40-year-old man who allegedly tried to end his life at his residence in Delhi's Jahangirpuri, officials said. Police reached the spot after receiving information about a person attempting to hang himself, following which two policemen undid the noose from the ceiling fan and brought him down, a police officer added.

119.title: BJP should hang its head in shame: Cong MP on SC's remarks on Nupur
119.article_body: Supreme Court's remarks on suspended BJP spokesperson Nupur Sharma's comments on Prophet should make BJP "hang its head in shame", a statement issued by Congress MP Jairam Ramesh said. "It's no secret that...BJP seeks to profit from inflaming communal passions," he added. The apex court had said that Sharma is "single-handedly responsible for what is happening in the country."

120.title: Save power: Japan to citizens after worst June heatwave since 1875
120.article_body: Amid rising temperatures, the Japanese government has asked citizens to reduce power use as much as possible, while running air conditioners to stay safe. The region around the Japanese capital Tokyo hit its seventh straight day of temperatures above 35 degrees Celsius on Friday. The June heat in Japan was the worst since record-keeping began in 1875.

121.title: Masterstroke of Devendra Fadnavis: Shinde on becoming Maha CM
121.article_body: Eknath Shinde, after taking oath as Maharashtra CM, said, "People thought that BJP was desperate for power. But truly, this is a masterstroke by Devendra [Fadnavis] ji." "To hand over power to another person despite having a larger number [of MLAs] requires a big heart," he added. "People...got to see a new example of this large heartedness," Shinde said.

122.title: Joe Root honoured with silver bat for completing 10,000 Test runs, ICC share pic
122.article_body: The ICC have shared a picture of former England captain Joe Root being presented with a silver bat to commemorate him for reaching 10,000 runs in Test cricket. Root reached the 10,000-run mark last month. He became the joint-youngest batter to reach the 10,000-run mark at the age of 31 years and 157 days, equalling Alastair Cook's record.

123.title: Portion of building collapses in Delhi's Paharganj, 30 rescued
123.article_body: A portion of a building in Delhi's Paharganj area collapsed on Thursday evening following which 30 people were rescued, police said. About eight to ten families, or at least thirty people, were inside the building at the time of the incident, police added. They were rescued without any injuries or deaths, or any loss of property, police further said.

124.title: Thailand scrambles jets after Myanmar's warplane enters Thai airspace
124.article_body: Thailand scrambled fighter jets near its border area on Thursday after a warplane from Myanmar violated the Thai airspace. The plane was carrying out attacks on ethnic minority rebels, a senior Thai official said. Though the incident may have appeared serious, it was "not a big deal", Thai PM Prayut Chan-o-cha said on Friday.

125.title: I will never confirm or deny: Kiara on rumours of dating Sidharth
125.article_body: Actress Kiara Advani reacted to the rumours of her relationship with actor Sidharth Malhotra, saying that people can assume what they want and she will never confirm or deny anything. "Although if you say something, it will be written about then as well so I feel that saying something won't make much of a difference," the actress added.

126.title: Why am I involved in this: Dakota on her video of 'noticing' Depp's finger
126.article_body: Actress Dakota Johnson reacted to her old video going viral during Johnny Depp and Amber Heard's defamation trial, saying, "I was like, 'Why am I involved in this...Don't let this go further.'" The video 'The EXACT moment Dakota Johnson KNEW Amber Heard was VIOLENT towards Johnny Depp' showed Dakota and Johnny talking about his injured finger during 'Black Mass' promotions.

127.title: Had Shah allowed Sena CM for 2.5 yrs in Maha, MVA wouldn't have been formed: Uddhav
127.article_body: After Shiv Sena rebel Eknath Shinde became CM of Maharashtra, former CM Uddhav Thackeray said, "I told Amit Shah earlier...that there should be a Shiv Sena CM for 2.5 years (during BJP-Sena alliance)." Thackeray said, "Had they done this earlier, there would've been no Maha Vikas Aghadi (MVA or Sena-Congress-NCP alliance)." He added, "A BJP leader would've been CM today."

128.title: Apple hikes price of iPhones, iPads in Japan as yen's value tanks
128.article_body: Apple has hiked the price of its iPhones and iPads in Japan amid a dip in the value of yen. It has added as much as 25% to the cost of its mobile gadgets, increasing iPhone 13's starting price up to $869.58, compared to $736.71 previously. It has increased the price of its iPad and iPad Air by $73.82 each.

129.title: Bumrah just wanted to talk about Test cricket; he loves it: Jayawardena
129.article_body: Mumbai Indians coach Mahela Jayawardena has said that India's interim-Test captain Jasprit Bumrah "loves" red-ball cricket. "It's just the passion that Bumrah has...The more time we spent in the Mumbai camp, Bumrah just wanted to talk red-ball cricket," Jayawardena said. He added, "Bumrah doesn't want to miss a single Test...which is an asset for India...He prioritises his Test cricket."

130.title: 23-year-old YouTuber Technoblade passes away due to stage 4 cancer
130.article_body: YouTuber Technoblade has passed away at the age of 23 after battling stage four cancer over the past year. The American internet personality had nearly 11 million subscribers on YouTube, where he posted clips of himself playing Minecraft. "If I had another hundred lives...I would choose to be Technoblade again every single time," the YouTuber said in his last message.

131.title: Tamil, Telugu industries pushing boundaries through films: Huma Qureshi
131.article_body: Actress Huma Qureshi, while talking about her experience of working in South Indian film industries, said industries like Tamil and Telugu "are not talking down to their audience". "They are pushing their boundaries," she added. The actress said that these industries take pride in the cultural references. "The stories are contextual...they are personalised, nuanced," Huma added.

132.title: 32 IPS officers including Udaipur IG, SP transferred after tailor's murder
132.article_body: Following the beheading of tailor Kanhaiya Lal in Rajasthan, 32 IPS officers, including Udaipur Inspector General (IG) and Superintendent of Police (SP), have been transferred. While IG Hinglaj Dan was posted as IG Civil Rights, SP Manoj Kumar was transferred to the second battalion of Rajasthan Armed Constabulary (RAC) in Kota. Praful Kumar has been made the new Udaipur IG.

133.title: Happy with my performance: Neeraj on silver-win at Stockholm Diamond League
133.article_body: After Neeraj Chopra won a silver medal at Stockholm Diamond League, the Tokyo Olympics gold medallist said he's happy with his performance. "It was quite close to 90 metres, I had a feeling that it would go beyond it but that didn't happen," he added. Neeraj threw 89.94 metres and broke his national record. Notably, it was his personal best.

134.title: A couple of weeks ago, I was close to retirement: Rafael Nadal
134.article_body: Rafael Nadal said he was close to retirement a "couple of weeks" back, adding he has never been afraid of retirement from tennis. "It's clear that when that day comes, I will [have to] change," stated Nadal. Nadal, who is currently playing Wimbledon for the first time since the 2019 edition, admitted that "every day" is a challenge.

135.title: 2 Tanzanian nationals held with cocaine worth over ₹4 lakh in Pune
135.article_body: Pune City Police have arrested two Tanzanian nationals and recovered around 29 milligrams of cocaine, worth over ₹4 lakh, from their possession. Police had received a tip-off, following which they laid a trap and arrested the suspects. According to police, one of the suspects had come to India about two years ago and was earlier arrested in a narcotics case.

136.title: Actress Shivani Rajashekar opts out of Miss India 2022 due to college exams
136.article_body: Actress Shivani Rajashekar, daughter of veteran actors Rajasekhar and Jeevitha, recently took part in Miss India 2022 pageant and represented Tamil Nadu. However, due to college exams, she had to opt out. "Regarding my health, I'm doing much better, and in Guntur right now for my exams," she added. There won't be any representation from Tamil Nadu this year.

137.title: Indian-origin tech businessman arrested for ₹355 crore investment fraud in US
137.article_body: A 50-year-old Indian-origin tech entrepreneur has been arrested in US for a $45 million (over ₹355 crore) investment fraud in which he allegedly cheated more than 10,000 people. Neil Chandran used a group of technology firms that he owned in a scheme to defraud investors. He promised extremely high returns by claiming his companies will be acquired by wealthy buyers.

138.title: First time I saw disco was with SRK, remember looking for shoes: Manoj
138.article_body: Actor Manoj Bajpayee recalled in an interview that the first time he ever saw a discotheque was with Shah Rukh Khan. He added that it was in Delhi in Maurya. "I still remember looking for shoes to get into the discotheque because I was in chappals," Manoj said. The two had studied acting together at Barry John Acting Studio.

139.title: 'Taarak Mehta...' team announces new Nattu Kaka, to be played by Kiran Bhatt
139.article_body: The makers of television show 'Taarak Mehta Ka Ooltah Chashmah' have announced that theatre artist Kiran Bhatt will be portraying the character of Nattu Kaka. The character was originally portrayed by late actor Ghanshyam Nayak who passed away in October 2021 after a long battle with cancer. Kiran and Ghanshyam were friends and the former called it an emotional role.

140.title: Ukraine begins electricity exports to EU: President Zelenskyy
140.article_body: Ukraine has started exporting electricity to the European Union via Romania, Ukrainian President Volodymyr Zelenskyy said. "Thanks to Ukrainian electricity, a significant part of the Russian gas used by European consumers can be replaced...[This is therefore] not just a question of export revenue for us, it is a question of security for the whole of Europe," he added.

141.title: MS Dhoni gets knee treatment from vaidya who sits under a tree near Ranchi
141.article_body: Ex-India captain MS Dhoni is getting knee treatment from a vaidya who sits under a tree near Ranchi in Jharkhand. Dhoni has been visiting the vaidya for last one month at an interval of four days to get the treatment. "Dhoni comes like a normal patient without any pomp. He has no pride in being a celebrity," the vaidya said.

142.title: Very heavy rainfall warning issued for several states; IMD releases list
142.article_body: IMD has predicted heavy to very heavy rainfall over Rajasthan, Uttarakhand, Madhya Pradesh, Himachal Pradesh, West Bengal, Sikkim, Odisha, Gujarat, Karnataka and Kerala over the next few days. Heavy to very heavy rainfall is also likely over Goa during the next four days. Isolated heavy rainfall is predicted in Jharkhand on  1st, 2nd, 3rd and 5th July.

143.title: 4 Amarnath Yatra pilgrims hurt as vehicle slips off road, overturns
143.article_body: Four pilgrims undertaking the Amarnath Yatra were injured on Friday when their vehicle slipped off a road and overturned on the national highway in the Sher Bibi area of Jammu and Kashmir's Ramban, police said. The victims, who hail from Chhattisgarh and Uttar Pradesh, were rushed to a nearby hospital for treatment.

144.title: Rajkummar on & off camera are 2 different personalities: Sanya Malhotra
144.article_body: Sanya Malhotra, while speaking about working with Rajkummar Rao in 'HIT - The First Case' said, "Raj on set and...in front of the camera are two different personalities." "He's very passionate and...professional. Our energies matched on...set from day one," the actress added. 'HIT - The First Case' is the Hindi remake of the Telugu mystery action thriller of same name.

145.title: I'm genetically 'filmy', doctor announced my blood group as U/A: Ranbir
145.article_body: Actor Ranbir Kapoor has said, "I've a bug in me...The bug of Hindi cinema." "It was obvious as my parents, grandparents and great grandparents, uncles and aunts...even my cousins are actors," he said, adding, "So I'm 'filmy' genetically...Doctor announced my blood group as U/A." U/A certificate is a censor rating given by the Central Board of Film Certification of India.

146.title: 15,000 pourakarmikas begin strike seeking permanent jobs in B'luru
146.article_body: Over 15,000 pourakarmikas (civic workers) began an indefinite strike in Bengaluru seeking permanent jobs and better pay on Friday. The pourakarmikas, waste collectors and manual labour, who keep the city clean, have also demanded dignified working conditions, safety equipment, etc. "We've been doing this work for the past 20 years but are yet to be made permanent," a pourakarmika said.

147.title: Gunmen attack Nigerian mine, kidnaps 4 Chinese nationals
147.article_body: Gunmen attacked a local mining site in northcentral Nigeria and abducted some workers, including four Chinese nationals, authorities said on Thursday. "Many security personnel" were killed in the attack, the Niger governor's office said. China in November had issued a travel advisory warning to its citizens and companies against travelling to "high-risk" areas in Nigeria and other parts of Africa.

148.title: India's playing XI for rescheduled 5th Test against England announced
148.article_body: England captain Ben Stokes won the toss and elected to bowl first against India in the rescheduled fifth Test at Edgbaston. Team India captain Jasprit Bumrah announced that Cheteshwar Pujara will open the innings for India along with Shubman Gill. Meanwhile, Ravichandran Ashwin has not been included in the playing XI. Shardul Thakur and Ravindra Jadeja feature in the XI.

149.title: 50-year-old man jumps in front of Delhi Metro train, hospitalised
149.article_body: A 50-year-old man allegedly jumped in front of a train at Delhi's Moolchand metro station on Thursday, police said. The man, identified as Mahendar, suffered injuries in the incident and was later taken to AIIMS Trauma Centre, where he's recuperating. Meanwhile, DMRC alerted commuters about the delay in metro services from Kashmere Gate to Badarpur Border due to the incident.

150.title: Bill Gates shares his 48-year-old résumé, says 'I'm sure yours looks a lot better'
150.article_body: World's fourth-richest person Bill Gates shared his résumé from 1974 on LinkedIn and wrote, "Whether you're a recent grad or a college dropout, I'm sure your résumé looks a lot better than mine did 48 years ago." The résumé, which the Microsoft Co-founder wrote during his first year at Harvard, lists his objective as a "systems analyst or systems programmer".

151.title: Grass has right to grow & donkey has right to eat in a democracy: SC on Nupur's plea
151.article_body: Supreme Court Justice Surya Kant, while criticising Nupur Sharma for her comments on the Prophet, remarked, "In a democracy, everyone has the right to speak." He added, "In a democracy, grass has the right to grow and a donkey has the right to eat." Suspended BJP leader Nupur had sought to transfer FIRs filed against her to Delhi.

152.title: 54 kg high-grade ganja seized on Solapur-Pune highway; 2 arrested
152.article_body: The Narcotics Control Bureau (NCB) has seized 54 kilograms of high-grade ganja worth approximately ₹85 lakh on the Solapur-Pune highway, officials said. At least two persons have been arrested for peddling the contraband, that was sourced from Odisha's Ganjam. The drugs were destined for further distribution to peddlers in Mumbai, Gujarat's Surat and other adjoining areas.

153.title: Factually untrue: Edelweiss on report of firm putting its Mutual Fund business for sale
153.article_body: Edelweiss has issued a clarification after a report claimed that the company has put its Mutual Fund business for sale. In a statement, Edelweiss said, "We strongly...deny the report...the news is factually untrue and purely speculative and motivated by vested interests." It further called its MF business a "strong franchisee" and shared its growth numbers.

154.title: Woman dies by suicide a month after husband's death in Gurugram; leaves note
154.article_body: A woman allegedly died by suicide a month after her husband was killed in a road accident in Gurugram. The 32-year-old woman was found hanging at her rented accommodation in Gurugram and was undergoing a financial crisis, police said. Notably, the deceased left a five-page suicide note in which she urged her mother to take care of her 10-year-old daughter.

155.title: PMC to declare alternate day water supply due to deficit rainfall
155.article_body: Pune Municipal Corporation (PMC) will declare a timetable for an alternate day water supply in the city from next week, Municipal Commissioner Vikram Kumar said. He added that this is due to a deficit in rainfall, which has caused less availability of water in dams. "There's hardly 2.5 TMC water in...dams supplying water to the city," a civic officer said.

156.title: UP CM Adityanath launches Amazon's first Digital Kendra in UP
156.article_body: Uttar Pradesh Chief Minister Yogi Adityanath has launched Amazon's first Digital Kendra in the state at an event in Lucknow. Amazon also signed two MoUs with MSMEs and the export promotion department of Uttar Pradesh. As part of the MoUs, Amazon will train and onboard MSMEs from the state on its Global Selling programme and export their products globally.

157.title: Ronaldo's lawyers seek $626,000 from rape accuser's lawyer in Las Vegas case
157.article_body: Cristiano Ronaldo's lawyers have asked a US judge to order the rape accuser's lawyer to pay the footballer $626,000 for claiming in a failed lawsuit that Ronaldo raped the woman in Las Vegas in 2009. This comes after a US judge dismissed the 2018 Nevada lawsuit, saying the alleged victim's lawyer harmed Ronaldo by conducting himself in "bad faith".

158.title: Nupur should have filed an FIR against the anchor if there was misuse of debate: SC
158.article_body: On being told by Nupur Sharma's counsel that her comments on Prophet were only in response to a fellow panellist and anchor Navika Kumar, the Supreme Court said there should've been a case against the host as well. "If there was misuse of...debate...the first thing [Nupur] should've done was to file an FIR against the anchor," the apex court said.

159.title: Some people love to take me down but they won't get me: Nick Kyrgios
159.article_body: Following a recent video where he was seen spitting in the direction of an abusive spectator during a Wimbledon 2022 match, Australian tennis player Nick Kyrgios said, "Some people love to take me down. They won't get me." "I don't really care if there's an investigation...for what happened the other day...People do not respect me on certain occasions," added Kyrgios.

160.title: India announce 22-member squad for World Athletics Championships
160.article_body: The Athletics Federation of India (AFI) has announced a 22-member squad for the upcoming World Athletics Championships. Olympic gold medallist Neeraj Chopra has been included in the squad. The 22-member squad includes 17 male athletes and five female athletes. Seven of the 16 athletes, who will compete in individual events, are National Record holders, the AFI stated.

161.title: ₹1.5 lakh cr wiped off Reliance's market value as govt raises export duty on fuel
161.article_body: Nearly ₹1.5 lakh crore has been wiped out from the market capitalisation of Reliance Industries after its stock declined as much as 8.7% on Friday, marking its biggest intraday drop since November 2, 2020. The shares fell after the Centre raised export duty on fuel. ONGC shares also plunged by 12.3% on Friday, its biggest slide since March 23, 2020.

162.title: 70-year-old man killed while he was asleep in Raj; at least 10 booked
162.article_body: A 70-year-old man was allegedly killed while he was asleep in his field in Rajasthan's Baran, police said. Around 10-12 locals have been booked for the alleged murder, police added. A suspect claimed the man recently electrocuted and killed one of their relatives. The victim had a fatal head injury, suggesting he was murdered with some heavy stone, police stated.

163.title: Missing 'Crypto Queen' Ruja Ignatova added to FBI's most wanted list for $4 bn fraud
163.article_body: Ruja Ignatova, also known as "Crypto Queen", has been placed on the FBI's top 10 most wanted list. Ignatova, who has been missing since 2017, is wanted for her alleged role in running a cryptocurrency scam known as OneCoin. Federal investigators accuse her of using the scheme to defraud victims out of more than $4 billion.

164.title: We are as good as married: Pavitra on relationship with Eijaz Khan
164.article_body: Actress Pavitra Punia, while speaking about her relationship with Eijaz Khan, said, "Everyone is always asking us about our marriage but honestly, we're as good as married." "When you've lived with someone for long, you stop looking at each other as boyfriend, girlfriend," she added. Pavitra further said they have been planning to marry since last year.

165.title: Russia using less precise Soviet-era missiles in Ukraine: General
165.article_body: Russia is using old Soviet-era missiles that are less accurate for more than 50% of its strikes in Ukraine, a brigadier general in Ukraine's armed forces said. Brigadier General Oleksii Hromov added that around 202 missiles had been fired on Ukraine in the second half of June, an increase of 120 from the first half of the month.

166.title: Will ensure error-free caste census in Bihar: Ex-JD(U) MP Anwar
166.article_body: Former JD(U) Rajya Sabha MP Ali Anwar has said that social organisations will ensure an error-free caste census takes place in Bihar. "Now that the caste survey is taking place, the ruling dispensation would get to know the bitter truth at home about the poor economic and educational status of a large section of the society," Anwar said.

167.title: We won't disturb new Maha govt, they must work for public: Raut
167.article_body: Shiv Sena MP Sanjay Raut has claimed that the BJP said from the first day that they'll "disturb" Uddhav Thackeray's government, however, his party "won't disturb" the new Maharashtra government. This comes after rebel Shiv Sena leader Eknath Shinde and BJP leader Devendra Fadnavis were sworn in as state CM and Deputy CM respectively. "They must work for...public," Raut said.

168.title: McCullum has a gift of getting into people's heads: Ex-Eng captain Gower
168.article_body: Ex-England captain David Gower said England Test head coach Brendon McCullum has a "gift" of getting into people's heads and making them feel better. "When McCullum's appointment was announced, people were wondering what his qualifications were. They are now apparent," added Gower. Talking about England Test captain Ben Stokes, Gower stated that Stokes has a "bulletproof" approach to cricket.

169.title: 19-yr-old runs over policeman to escape checkpoint in Mumbai; arrested
169.article_body: A 19-year-old youth was arrested for allegedly ramming his two-wheeler into a 56-year-old policeman at a checkpoint in Mumbai's Wadala area on Wednesday. The youth, who was stopped for driving without helmet, ran over the policeman in an attempt to escape but was nabbed by other officials. The policeman sustained three fractures in his right shoulder and other minor injuries.

170.title: 'You Hold The Cards': Shahid Kapoor in PokerBaazi's brand film
170.article_body: PokerBaazi.com has launched a campaign 'You Hold The Cards' featuring Shahid Kapoor. The campaign aims to highlight how luck controls outcomes in life while in poker, players' skills can triumph over luck. Kapoor said, "I look forward to helping PokerBaazi reach wider audiences & create advocates for the sport,” resonating with the brand's mission of making poker a household game.

171.title: Lost out on Slumdog Millionaire as I was too good-looking for it: Gauahar
171.article_body: Actress Gauahar Khan has revealed that she lost out on the Academy Award-winning movie 'Slumdog Millionaire' because she was "too good-looking for it". "He (Danny Boyle, director) said 'You're...a fab actor but somehow I won't be able to cast you...because I've to match three age groups...and I can't place you in a Slumdog Millionaire with your face'," Gauahar added.

172.title: Good to see Pujara decided to play in county cricket: Harbhajan
172.article_body: Former India spinner Harbhajan Singh has said that it's "good to see" that batter Cheteshwar Pujara picked the option of playing in England's county cricket. "He has been playing continuously in English conditions.
