Though you might say that in county cricket, the quality of bowlers is not like in international cricket...[But over there] you encounter one-two (international) bowlers," Singh said.

173.title: South African man charged with record $1.7 bn Bitcoin fraud in US
173.article_body: The US commodities regulator CFTC has charged a South African man and his company for operating a fraudulent commodity pool worth over $1.7 billion in Bitcoin. It is the largest fraud scheme the CFTC has ever pursued involving Bitcoin. The firm claimed to have proprietary software that would realise significant trading gains for investors who pooled their Bitcoin with it.

174.title: He raised standards of parliamentary debates: PM on VP Naidu's b'day
174.article_body: Prime Minister Narendra Modi on Friday wished Vice President M Venkaiah Naidu on his birthday and called him an "inspiration for the citizens". "As our VP, he has played a key role in raising the standards of parliamentary proceedings and debates. Praying for his long life," PM Modi tweeted. Notably, Vice President Venkaiah Naidu's term will end on August 10.

175.title: WhatsApp may get animated avatars for video calls, stickers: Report
175.article_body: WhatsApp is reportedly working on emoji-inspired avatars as its latest feature. As per a report, users can use these avatars as their profile pictures and during video calls when the camera is switched off. While the feature is still not in its final form, the avatars may also be available as stickers that can be shared within chats.

176.title: I came close to getting married thrice, all three times god saved me: Sushmita Sen
176.article_body: Opening up about marriage, actress Sushmita Sen said, "Luckily I met some very interesting men in my life, the only reason I never got married is [that] they were a let down." She added, "I came close to getting married thrice, all three times god saved me. I can't tell you what disasters followed with their respective lives."

177.title: Sushmita's brother, wife Charu to separate; he says 'Didn't know about her 1st marriage'
177.article_body: Sushmita Sen's brother Rajeev and his wife Charu Asopa are heading towards a divorce. Rajeev said he was not aware of Charu's first marriage, adding, "It was...kept hidden from us." Meanwhile, Charu said, "Not only did he know about it, but also appreciated me for moving on from my past." Rajeev and Charu tied the knot in 2019.

178.title: What has Delhi Police done? There must be red carpet for you: SC to Nupur's lawyer
178.article_body: While refusing to allow suspended BJP leader Nupur Sharma's plea for transferring FIRs registered against her over remarks on Prophet Muhammad to Delhi, the Supreme Court said, "What has Delhi police done...Don't make us open our mouth." After being told by her lawyer that she has joined probe, the court remarked, "Then what happened...There must have been...red carpet for you."

179.title: Afghan Sikhs arrive in Delhi, bring ashes of man killed in gurdwara attack
179.article_body: Eleven Afghan Sikhs arrived in New Delhi on Thursday less than two weeks after two people were killed in a terrorist attack on a gurdwara in Kabul. They also brought the ashes of Sawinder Singh, who was killed in the June 18 attack. The Indian government had on June 19 granted emergency e-visas to 111 Afghan Hindus and Sikhs.

180.title: Hyderabad Police arrest 2 inter-state drug peddlers, seize 25 kg ganja
180.article_body: The Hyderabad Police said that they have arrested two inter-state drug peddlers and recovered 25 kg of ganja from them. According to police, the accused have been smuggling drugs since 2020 and have ties with drug dealers in Andhra Pradesh. Based on a tip-off, the police arrested the accused on Tuesday while they were proceeding towards Borabanda from Nacharam.

181.title: Maha Guv asks CM Eknath Shinde to prove majority in Assembly on July 4
181.article_body: Maharashtra Governor Bhagat Singh Koshyari has asked CM Eknath Shinde to prove a majority in Assembly on July 4 (Monday). A special session of the Maharashtra Assembly is scheduled to be held on July 3 and 4. The nomination for Speaker's elections will be filed on July 2 and the Speaker's elections will be held on July 3.

182.title: Instagram tests turning video posts into Reels
182.article_body: Instagram has said that it is testing a change that turns video posts into Reels. "We're testing this feature as part of our efforts to simplify and improve the video experience on Instagram," a spokesperson from Meta said. People who are part of the test will reportedly see an in-app message that says "video posts are now shared as Reels".

183.title: 30 riders booked in last 2 days for excessive bike noise in Pune
183.article_body: In a drive conducted by the Pimpri-Chinchwad Police, around 30 riders have been booked in the past two days for tinkering with their bike silencers and causing noise pollution in Pune. The riders have been booked under the Noise Pollution (Regulation and Control) Rules, 2000, police said. Notably, several residents have complained of excessive bike noise, police added.

184.title: 8-yr-old girl dies after scorpion stings her at C'garh govt school
184.article_body: An eight-year-old girl died after a scorpion stung her while she was playing at a government school in Chhattisgarh's Bemetara, officials said on Thursday. The girl was being shifted to Raipur due to her critical condition but she died on the way, officials added. On state CM's order, District Education Officer provided ₹1 lakh financial assistance to the girl's father.

185.title: Ecuador govt, indigenous groups sign deal to end 18 days of protests
185.article_body: The Ecuadorian government and indigenous groups’ leaders on Thursday signed an agreement to end 18 days of protests against soaring fuel and food prices. As part of the deal, Ecuador’s government has agreed to lower the fuel costs by 15 cents per gallon. The deal also sets limits on the expansion of oil exploration areas and restricts certain mining activities.

186.title: Mom was very happy with me playing a sardar in 'Rocket Singh': Ranbir
186.article_body: Ranbir Kapoor, while speaking about his 2009 film 'Rocket Singh: Salesman of the Year', said, "This film broke my heart when it didn't do well." "My mother was very happy with me playing a sardar because she's a sardarni," he added. Ranbir further said he meets a lot of people who appreciate the film and his character in the film.

187.title: 4 carry weapons in bid to rob people near Pune rly station, held
187.article_body: Pune police arrested four persons, aged between 19 and 29, who were planning to rob people near the city's railway station. The incident occurred on Wednesday and the accused were carrying weapons and chilli powder, officials said. "Our team laid a trap near station where we nabbed them, but one of the gang members fled the spot," an official said.

188.title: Eng will win 5th Test, India would've won the series last year: Moeen
188.article_body: England all-rounder Moeen Ali said they "will win" the rescheduled fifth Test of the series against India which they trail 1-2 as India are "undercooked". "If this series had finished off last year, India would have won it," added Moeen. The Test series initially started in 2021 with the fifth Test cancelled due to COVID-19 fears and eventually rescheduled.

189.title: Received a love letter: Pawar on IT notices regarding election affidavits
189.article_body: NCP chief Sharad Pawar on Thursday tweeted that he has received notices from Income Tax (IT) department over his election affidavits in 2004, 2009, 2014 and 2020. "This device is utilised against those who hold views different than those of the Centre. I have received such a love letter," Pawar wrote. Notably, Eknath Shinde became Maharashtra's new CM on Thursday.

190.title: RIL shares fall by 5%, its biggest decline in 18 months after govt raises fuel excise duty
190.article_body: After the Centre announced an increase in taxes on the export of petrol, diesel, and aviation turbine fuel (ATF), shares of Reliance Industries Ltd (RIL), ONGC and Oil India witnessed a decline. While RIL shares plunged over 5% in its biggest decline in about 18 months, shares of ONGC dropped by 10% during intraday trade on Friday.

191.title: FBI adds 'Cryptoqueen' to 10 Most Wanted Fugitive list, offers reward
191.article_body: The FBI has added OneCoin cryptocurrency Founder Ruja Ignatova, also known as "Cryptoqueen", to its Ten Most Wanted Fugitive list for allegedly defrauding investors of over $4 billion over three years. A reward of up to $100,000 has been offered for her arrest. Ignatova allegedly made false statements and representations to individuals in order to solicit investments in OneCoin.

192.title: This lady is single-handedly responsible for what's happening in India: SC on Nupur
192.article_body: While hearing suspended BJP leader Nupur Sharma's plea to transfer FIRs over remarks on Prophet Muhammad, the Supreme Court said she should apologise to entire nation on TV. "The way she...ignited emotions across the country...this lady is single-handedly responsible for what's happening in the country...She and her loose tongue has set the entire country on fire," the Supreme Court said.

193.title: B'luru police raid gambling den, seize ₹1 lakh cash; 22 arrested
193.article_body: The Bengaluru police's Crime Branch conducted a raid at a gambling den and arrested 22 persons, Joint CP (Crime) Raman Gupta tweeted on Thursday. He said that the accused had been engaged in Andar Bahar game and cash worth a total of over ₹1 lakh was also seized from them. He added that of the total accused, 18 are customers.

194.title: Would've made more sense to pick Pujara as captain: Jaffer on 5th Test
194.article_body: Ex-India opener Wasim Jaffer said it would have made "more sense" to pick Cheteshwar Pujara as the captain for the fifth rescheduled Test against England rather than Jasprit Bumrah. "I've seen Pujara lead in first-class cricket. He's a decent enough leader...Bumrah hasn't [been a] captain at all...[However] Bumrah might surprise us as Hardik Pandya did [as a captain]," added Jaffer.

195.title: Uddhav has lost the spirit to fight: Former Maharashtra CM Chavan
195.article_body: Congress leader and former Maharashtra CM Prithviraj Chavan said Uddhav Thackeray has lost his fighting spirit. "Uddhav Thackeray should have put forth his view within the state assembly. Thereafter, he could have resigned. People should have known his views," Chavan stated. He further claimed that Eknath Shinde had wished to become Chief Minister the way Manohar Joshi became in 1995.

196.title: China's Xi swears in new Hong Kong leader as city marks 25 yrs of handover
196.article_body: Chinese President Xi Jinping on Friday officiated the swearing-in ceremony of Hong Kong's new leader John Lee as the city marked 25 years since its handover from British to Chinese rule. Following the swearing-in, the Chinese President said there was no reason to change Hong Kong's "one country, two systems" formula of governance as it has proven to be successful.

197.title: Shiv Sena moves SC seeking suspension of Maharashtra CM, 15 rebel MLAs
197.article_body: Shiv Sena chief whip Sunil Prabhu has moved the Supreme Court seeking suspension of Maharashtra CM Eknath Shinde and 15 rebel MLAs till the decision on their disqualification is taken. The plea seeks an order restraining them from entering the Maharashtra Legislative Assembly. The disqualification notices were earlier issued to 16 rebel MLAs by state Assembly's Deputy Speaker Narhari Zirwal.

198.title: Govt increases export duty on petrol by ₹5 per litre, diesel by ₹12 per litre
198.article_body: The government on Friday increased the export duty on petrol, diesel, and aviation turbine fuel (ATF). Export duty on petrol has been raised by ₹5 per litre and ₹12 per litre on diesel. Export duty on ATF has been upped by ₹6 per litre. Increase in export duty on the various fuels will not increase domestic fuel prices.

199.title: Plum announces its Birthday Bash sale with discounts of up to 50%
199.article_body: 100% vegan beauty and personal care brand Plum has announced its biggest sale of the season, 'The Plum Birthday Bash', from July 1 to 4. The brand is offering discounts of up to 50% along with exciting freebies worth ₹1,500, Plum stated, adding that one lucky winner stands a chance to win an iPhone 13 every day.

200.title: Mumbai sees waterlogging, traffic jams amid rains; orange alert issued
200.article_body: Amid heavy rains on Thursday, several parts of Mumbai witnessed waterlogging and traffic jams. The India Meteorological Department (IMD) has issued an 'orange' alert for Mumbai predicting heavy to very heavy showers over the next two days. Mumbai received 119.09 mm of rain from 8 am to 8 pm on Thursday, as per the city's civic body.

201.title: Ashwin has had Stokes' measure a lot over his career: Watson on 5th Test
201.article_body: Ex-Australia all-rounder Shane Watson said he is "really looking forward" to the battle between Ravichandran Ashwin and England Test captain Ben Stokes in the rescheduled fifth Test. "Ashwin has had his measure a lot over his career," added Watson. "Ashwin is going to be the main man to try and make the most of that battle," he stated.

202.title: You never know who you’ll run into in New York: Bill Gates on meeting Mahesh, Namrata
202.article_body: After actor Mahesh Babu shared a picture of himself and his wife Namrata Shirodkar meeting Bill Gates, the Microsoft Co-founder said, "Being in New York is always fun." He added, "You never know who you’ll run into. It was great meeting you and Namrata!" Mahesh responded, "Honour is all ours, Mr Gates! One of our favourite moments ever."

203.title: Govt hikes import tax on gold from 7.5% to 12.5% amid declining rupee
203.article_body: The central government has raised the basic import tax on gold to 12.5% from 7.5% as the Indian rupee declined to a record low. India, the world's second-biggest consumer of gold, imported gold worth $6.03 billion in May, a nine-fold rise from a year earlier. Notably, last year the Centre had cut the tax to 7.5% in the Budget.

204.title: 'Strange' cloud hangs over Ukraine's Kyiv, video of dry thunderstorm goes viral
204.article_body: A video of a dry thunderstorm in Ukraine's capital Kyiv has gone viral on social media. Olexander Scherba, a former Ukrainian diplomat, tweeted, "The whole Kyiv saw and heard the strange cloud hanging over the city. Thunder and lightning without storm." Reacting to the video, a user tweeted, "Guardians of the Galaxy!"

205.title: I'm done with 'Tanu Weds...', don't want to go back to being Manu: Madhavan
205.article_body: R Madhavan, on being asked if he'd be returning as Manu in another 'Tanu Weds Manu' movie, said he's done with the franchise and doesn't want to go back to being Manu now. "There's no point in beating a dead horse," he added. "If it's...sequel to Avengers...it's easier because you've a template...But with Tanu Weds Manu, it's impossible," said Madhavan.

206.title: Always playing a hero is boring: John on playing villain in Ek Villain Returns
206.article_body: John Abraham, speaking about doing a negative role in 'Ek Villain Returns', said, "Always playing a hero is boring...It's good to play...villain." He added it's kind of a homecoming for him as he played a character with a negative shade in his 2003 film 'Jism'. John further said he loved the script when he heard it for the first time.

207.title: Drugs worth ₹58.84 cr seized in Mumbai so far this year: Police
207.article_body: The Mumbai Police has seized over 1,000 kg of drugs worth ₹58.84 crore in the city from January till May this year. Police also arrested 4,968 people for their alleged involvement in drug-related offences during the period. According to data provided by the police, the most valued seized drugs include mephedrone (MD) worth ₹18 crore and heroin worth ₹11.94 crore.

208.title: Hyd startup successfully tests satellite deployer on ISRO's PSLV C53
208.article_body: Hyderabad-based space tech startup Dhruva Space has successfully tested and space-qualified its satellite orbital deployer (DSOD 1U) which was aboard ISRO's PSLV C53 on June 30. Dhruva Space utilised the PSLV Orbital Experimental Module (POEM) for the test. The successful test has laid the path for the startup's satellite missions, Thybolt-1 and Thybolt-2, which would be onboard PSLV C54 mission.

209.title: We beat NZ who're the world's best team but India are different: Stokes
209.article_body: England Test captain Ben Stokes said he considers New Zealand whom his team defeated 3-0 in the recently concluded Test series as the "best team in the world". "India are obviously a completely different opposition [and] a different dynamic of a team," stated Stokes. England will take on India in the fifth rescheduled Test which starts today.

210.title: Root can surpass Tendulkar's record of most Test runs: Compton
210.article_body: Former English cricketer Nick Compton has said that batter Joe Root can surpass former India batter Sachin Tendulkar's record of most runs in Test cricket. "I think he can. He's (Root) young and is right up there with Tendulkar in terms of runs scored at 31 [years of age]...If he can keep going like this, he'll get there," Compton said.

211.title: I think Fadnavis didn't accept Maha Deputy CM post happily: Pawar
211.article_body: NCP chief Sharad Pawar claimed on Thursday that he doesn't think that former Maharashtra CM Devendra Fadnavis accepted the Deputy CM post "happily", adding, "His facial expression said it all." "[Fadnavis] must have followed...orders from the top," he also claimed. Furthermore, he alleged that rebel Shiv Sena leader Eknath Shinde "himself had no idea" that he'd get the CM post.

212.title: Ketanji Jackson sworn in, becomes 1st Black woman on US Supreme Court
212.article_body: Ketanji Brown Jackson has been sworn in as a US Supreme Court justice, becoming the first black woman to serve on the nation's highest court. "Her historic swearing-in...represents a profound step forward for our nation, for all...young, Black girls who now see themselves reflected on our highest court, and for all of us as Americans," US President Joe Biden said.

213.title: Kohli will get the ton he's 'desperate' for if he scores 30: Vaughan
213.article_body: Ex-England captain Michael Vaughan said Virat Kohli will score the century he has been "desperately" seeking for a "long period of time", if he scores 30 runs in the upcoming fifth rescheduled Test against England. "Just go back a few years when he produced one of the greatest Test match centuries [at Edgbaston]. I think he's due," added Vaughan.

214.title: Rupee hits fresh record low of 79.12 against US dollar
214.article_body: Amid a strengthening dollar and rising global crude oil prices, the Indian rupee hit a fresh record low of 79.12 against the US dollar after the currency opened at 78.98 in Friday's session. The rupee had touched the 79-mark for the first time ever after it closed at a record low of 79.03 against the US dollar on Wednesday.

215.title: Ex-Apple exec's firm files for bankruptcy months after going public
215.article_body: Former Apple and JC Penney executive Ron Johnson-led retail startup Enjoy Technology has filed for bankruptcy, months after going public through a special-purpose acquisition company (SPAC). The startup plans to sell its US assets to technology repair company Asurion. A court filing has said that Enjoy has struggled with declining liquidity and an inability to retain staff.

216.title: SpaceX gets nod to use its Starlink internet on boats, planes in US
216.article_body: The US FCC has authorised Elon Musk-owned SpaceX to use its Starlink satellite internet system on moving vehicles, like trucks, boats and aircraft. "Authorising a new class of terminals for SpaceX's satellite system will expand the range of broadband capabilities to meet the growing user demands," the FCC said. SpaceX has launched over 2,500 Starlink satellites to low-Earth orbit.

217.title: Woman, lover arrested for killing aunt, her son over ₹4 lakh loan in UP
217.article_body: A woman and her lover were arrested for allegedly killing her 40-year-old aunt and the latter's 18-year-old son in Uttar Pradesh's Mathura, police said. The accused were unable to repay a loan of ₹4 lakh taken from victims almost a year ago, police added. This comes three months after the bodies of the victims were found floating in a canal.

218.title: Daily wager electrocuted to death while disconnecting 11kV wire in Gurugram
218.article_body: A daily wager died of electrocution while trying to disconnect a 11kV wire from an electric pole in Gurugram. The deceased, Sheikh Chotu (27), was asked by a private firm's officials to disconnect high-tension wires, police said. Meanwhile, the two employees of the firm have been booked. Notably, this is the second such death within a fortnight in the city.

219.title: Don't gather at ED office: Raut to Sena workers ahead of questioning
219.article_body: Shiv Sena MP Sanjay Raut has tweeted that he'll appear before Enforcement Directorate (ED) today at 12 noon and appealed to his party workers to "not gather" at the agency's office. Raut is being questioned by ED in a money laundering case linked to Patra Chawl redevelopment scam. "I respect [ED's summons]...it's my duty to co-operate with...investigation agencies," he said.

220.title: Ban on single-use plastic items in India comes into effect from today
220.article_body: The ban on single-use plastic items in India has come into effect from today. The ban prohibits manufacture, import, stocking, distribution, sale and use of the following identified single-use plastic items, which have low utility and high littering potential. The single-use plastic items prohibited include earbuds, straws, plates, cups, forks, spoons and knives, among other items.

221.title: Actor Kamal Haasan receives UAE's Golden Visa
221.article_body: The United Arab Emirates has given Golden Visa to actor Kamal Haasan. Vijay Sethupathi, Trisha, Mohanlal, Mammootty, Tovino Thomas, Dulquer Salmaan and Jayasurya are among other members of the South Indian film fraternity who have received the visa. The Golden Visa permits long-term (5 and 10 years) residency for foreigners.

222.title: Steak, sausage can't be used to describe vegetarian food: France
222.article_body: France will become the first European Union country to ban the use of meat names like "steak" and "sausage" to describe plant-based food, according to an official decree. "It'll not be possible to use sector-specific terminology traditionally associated with meat and fish to designate products that don't belong to the animal world and which, in essence, aren't comparable," decree read.

223.title: Man on scooter throws bomb at CPI(M) headquarters in Kerala; video surfaces
223.article_body: A man on a scooter threw a crude bomb at the Kerala headquarters of the ruling CPI(M) on Thursday night in Thiruvananthapuram. The video of the incident shows that the bomb exploded in front of the main gate of the party office. Reportedly, several CPI(M) leaders were at an apartment near the office at the time of the attack.

224.title: India sees 17,070 new COVID-19 cases, 1,749 less than yesterday
224.article_body: India recorded 17,070 new COVID-19 cases in the last 24 hours, according to latest data by the Ministry of Health and Family Welfare. This comes a day after the country saw 18,819 cases. Active cases in India stand at 1,07,189, while the death toll has risen to 5,25,139, according to the latest data.

225.title: Reliance to launch British sandwich & coffee chain Pret A Manger in India
225.article_body: Reliance Industries on Thursday said it will be opening outlets of British sandwich and coffee chain Pret A Manger in India, marking its first foray into the food and beverage retail business. The first outlet would reportedly open in Mumbai before March 2023. Pret A Manger, whose name means "ready to eat" in French, first opened in London in 1986.

226.title: Nadal enters 3rd round of Wimbledon after beating Ricardas Berankis
226.article_body: Rafael Nadal entered Wimbledon's third round after beating world number 106 Ricardas Berankis, which marked his 307th win in a Grand Slam match. Nadal made 39 unforced errors and recorded 35 winners in the match whose scoreline read 6-4, 6-4, 4-6, 6-3. Nadal lost the third set having won the opening two sets marking the second instance in two matches.

227.title: Eknath Shinde changes Twitter profile pic to one with Bal Thackeray after becoming CM
227.article_body: After taking oath as the Chief Minister of Maharashtra, Eknath Shinde changed the profile picture of his Twitter handle to one with Bal Thackeray. Shinde had earlier said that Uddhav Thackeray had diluted the Hindutva ideology of Bal Thackeray by forming a coalition with Sharad Pawar's Nationalist Congress Party (NCP) and the Congress, which he called an "unnatural alliance".

228.title: Situation in India a cause for fear, there is a reason to be afraid now: Amartya Sen
228.article_body: Nobel laureate Amartya Sen has said, "I think if someone asks me if I'm scared of something, I would say 'yes'. There is a reason to be afraid now. The current situation in India has become a cause for fear." "India cannot be of Hindus only. Again, Muslims alone cannot make India. Everyone has to work together," he added.

229.title: There are people at Meta who shouldn't be here: Zuckerberg on hiring cuts
229.article_body: Meta CEO Mark Zuckerberg while informing his employees about the hiring cuts at the company this year, remarked, "There are probably a bunch of people at the company who shouldn't be here." Speaking about "turning up the heat" on performance, "I think some of you might decide that this place isn't for you, and that self-selection is okay with me."

230.title: Cryptocurrencies are a clear danger: RBI Governor
230.article_body: RBI Governor Shaktikanta Das on Thursday described cryptocurrencies as a "clear danger", adding, "Anything that derives value based on make-believe, without any underlying, is just speculation under a sophisticated name." In the foreword to the 25th issue of the Financial Stability Report (FSR), Das also noted that as the financial system gets increasingly digitalised, cyber risks are growing.

231.title: Google to pay $90 mn to settle case with developers over app store
231.article_body: Google has agreed to pay $90 million to settle a case with app developers for allegedly violating antitrust laws and harming developers through app store policies. It allegedly used its deal with smartphone makers, technical barriers and revenue-sharing agreements to close the app ecosystem. Google has said it would put $90 million in a fund to support certain developers.

232.title: 2 B'luru policemen save boy attempting to die by suicide; rewarded
232.article_body: Two police officers in Bengaluru, ASI Ramesh and HC Chandrashekhar, were rewarded after they saved a boy who was attempting to die by suicide, DCP (South Division) P Krishnakant tweeted on Thursday. The DCP said that the police officers had rushed to the spot, rescued the "unconscious boy" and shifted him to a hospital. "A life was saved," he added.

233.title: Traffic diversions announced in Hyd for BJP's national executive meet
233.article_body: The Cyberabad Traffic Police have released a traffic advisory in view of the national executive meet of BJP on July 2 and 3. While vehicles will be diverted at COD Junction, people have also been asked to avoid the Hitex and Cyber Towers Junctions. Offices located between Kavuri Hills and Kothaguda Junction have been advised to stagger work timings accordingly.

234.title: 2 buildings collapse in Mumbai's Kalbadevi, Sion; 3 such incidents in 4 days
234.article_body: A portion of a 100-year-old building in Mumbai's Kalbadevi collapsed on Thursday and no casualties were reported. Another such incident happened in Sion where a portion of ground-plus-five structures fell. The Maharashtra Housing and Area Development Authority was carrying out repair works at the Kalbadevi building. Notably, this takes the total number of such incidents to three in four days.

235.title: Europe to see high levels of COVID-19 this summer, warns WHO
235.article_body: The World Health Organization said it expects "high levels" of COVID-19 in Europe this summer. COVID-19 "won't go away just because countries stop looking for it. It's still spreading...changing and...taking lives", WHO Europe's Regional Director Hans Kluge said. The 53 countries in WHO's European region are now reporting nearly 5,00,000 cases daily, up from 1,50,000 at May-end, WHO data showed.

236.title: Pantaloons announces Grand Fashion Sale with upto 60% off
236.article_body: Pantaloons has announced its Grand Fashion Sale with up to 60% off on women's, men's, and kids' clothing. Customers can avail discounts by visiting the Pantaloons stores or shopping online via the Pantaloons website or app. "Don't pick just one or two styles when you can buy them all, grab the trendiest styles at your nearest store," said the brand.

237.title: Video shows Neeraj Chopra nearly breaching 90-metre mark to break his own national record
237.article_body: A video shows India's Olympic gold-medal winning javelin thrower Neeraj Chopra nearly breaching the 90-metre mark to break his own national record. The 24-year-old set the national record with a best throw of 89.94 metres at the Stockholm Diamond League. It was the second time in a month that Neeraj broke his own national record.

238.title: Wasim Jaffer names India playing XI for Test against England that begins today
238.article_body: Former India opener Wasim Jaffer has named his Team India playing XI for the rescheduled fifth Test against England that will begin at Edgbaston today. Jaffer named Shubman Gill and Cheteshwar Pujara as the openers. He also included both Ravindra Jadeja and Ravichandran Ashwin in the team. He named Hanuma Vihari as the number three batter.

239.title: Meta to reduce hiring, warns staff of 'serious times' in internal memo
239.article_body: CEO Mark Zuckerberg told Meta employees that it will reduce hiring engineers by at least 30% this year. He added, "This might be one of the worst downturns...we've seen in recent history". Meanwhile, Chief Product Officer Chris Cox in an internal memo to the staff also wrote, "I have to underscore that we're in serious times here and...headwinds are fierce."

240.title: 50-yr-old man smoking on 10th floor balcony slips in Gurugram, dies
240.article_body: A 50-year-old man, who was smoking on the balcony of the 10th floor of a building in Gurugram's Sector-83 on Thursday, allegedly accidentally slipped and fell to death, police said. The balcony fencing was short due to which he might have lost his balance, police added. The family members do not suspect any foul play, police further said.

241.title: Rottweiler attacks retired policeman, his dog in Pune; FIR filed
241.article_body: A case has been filed after Rottweiler attacked a retired Assistant Commissioner of Police (ACP) and his dog while they were out for a walk. The ACP had previously told the Rottweiler's owner that the dog breed wasn't allowed in residential areas due to their aggressive nature, according to the complaint. The Rottweiler had pounced on and bitten the ACP.

242.title: Lightning hits boat carrying 7 people in US; incident caught on camera
242.article_body: The US Coast Guard rescued seven people after the boat they were in was struck by lightning 100 miles off the coast of Florida. None of the passengers were injured in the incident, which was caught on camera. The occupants of the boat were brought back to an air station where they met their relatives, the US Coast Guard said.

243.title: 'Alien things' near border with S Korea responsible for COVID-19 outbreak: N Korea
243.article_body: North Korea on Friday claimed that the country's first COVID-19 outbreak began with people touching "alien things" near the border with South Korea. North Korea ordered people to "vigilantly deal with alien things coming by wind and other climate phenomena and balloons in the areas along the demarcation line and borders", according to state media.

244.title: Mumbai teen dies by suicide after sister throws phone in drain
244.article_body: A 17-year-old girl allegedly died by suicide after her elder sister threw her mobile phone into a drain in Mumbai's Malad on Thursday, police said. The deceased was involved with a boy and her family had found out about it, an official said. The girl's elder sister scolded her and threw her phone in a drain, the official added.

245.title: Team India squads for T20I and ODI series against England announced
245.article_body: Team India squads for T20I and ODI series against England have been announced. Captain Rohit Sharma, who will miss the Test, will return for both the ODI and T20I series. Virat Kohli and Jasprit Bumrah will join the white-ball squad from second T20I onwards. Shikhar Dhawan, Prasidh Krishna, Mohammad Shami and Mohammed Siraj have been selected just for ODI series.

246.title: Neeraj breaks his own national record again, finishes 2nd at Stockholm Diamond League
246.article_body: Olympic gold medal-winning javelin thrower Neeraj Chopra broke his own national record at the Stockholm Diamond League. The 24-year-old finished runner-up in the event with a best throw of 89.94 metres. He had set the previous national record with an 89.30-metre throw at the Paavo Nurmi Games earlier this month after breaking his own national record of 88.07-metre throw.

247.title: Uddhav congratulates CM Shinde, says 'I wish you do a good job in Maharashtra'
247.article_body: Former Maharashtra CM Uddhav Thackeray on Thursday congratulated Shiv Sena's Eknath Shinde and BJP leader Devendra Fadnavis on being sworn in as new CM and Deputy CM respectively. "I wish you do a good job in Maharashtra!" Thackeray said on Twitter. Thackeray resigned as the CM on Wednesday after the Supreme Court rejected Shiv Sena's plea to stay floor test.

248.title: Mahhi accuses cook of threatening to kill her family, says 'Scared for daughter's life'
248.article_body: Actor-couple Mahhi Vij and Jay Bhanushali filed a police complaint on Thursday after their cook allegedly threatened to kill them. "He openly told me he will kill me with khanjar...Scared for my...daughter's life," she wrote in a series of now-deleted tweets. "When we went to the police station he kept calling me. I have all the recordings," Mahhi told ETimes.

249.title: Tom Hiddleston, fiancée Zawe Ashton expecting 1st child; pic shows actress' baby bump
249.article_body: Actor Tom Hiddleston and his fiancée, actress Zawe Ashton are expecting their first child together. Zawe, who attended the premiere of her new movie 'Mr Malcolm's List' in New York, was photographed with her baby bump for the first time. Hiddleston confirmed his engagement with the actress earlier in June.

250.title: Special Maha Assembly sessions on July 2, 3; Speaker election to be held
250.article_body: The Maharashtra Cabinet has decided to call special sessions of the Assembly on July 2 and 3. On the first day of the session, the election for Speaker will be completed as the post is vacant since Nana Patole's resignation. The decision comes after Eknath Shinde took oath as the new Chief Minister of Maharashtra.

251.title: 18-year-old girl dies of rabies a month after being bitten by dog in Kerala
251.article_body: An 18-year-old student, who was being treated for rabies, passed away on Thursday, a month after she was bitten by a dog in Kerala's Palakkad district, her relative said. The girl, who took anti-rabies injections, was reportedly taken to a private hospital after she started showing symptoms. The dog reportedly also bit its owner a day before biting her.

252.title: Punjab passes resolution against Panjab University's central status
252.article_body: Punjab Assembly has passed a resolution against giving Panjab University (PU) the status of a central university. Punjab Education Minister Gurmeet Singh Meet Hayer moved the resolution and called it a matter of identity, saying, "We will not let the central government centralise it at any cost." Only BJP MLAs Jangi Lal Mahajan and Ashwani Sharma opposed the resolution.

253.title: Time has come to say bye bye Modi: KT Rama Rao over price rise
253.article_body: Telangana minister KT Rama Rao on Thursday said that it was time to say "bye bye" to PM Narendra Modi. "The gas cylinder price in India is the highest in the world. Modi brought rupee value to ₹79 (against US dollar) in 75 years of Indian independence...Now the time has come to say 'bye bye Modi'," KTR said.

254.title: Bad news for Uddhav: Omar after Eknath Shinde sworn-in as Maha CM
254.article_body: After Eknath Shinde was sworn-in as the Chief Minister of Maharashtra, former Jammu and Kashmir CM Omar Abdullah said it was bad news for Shiv Sena chief Uddhav Thackeray and his branch. "Uddhav was probably counting on a BJP CM giving him a political weapon to target Shinde with," Omar said. This makes rebuilding Shiv Sena more difficult, he added.

255.title: BJP seeks ex-ally SAD's support for Droupadi Murmu in Prez polls
255.article_body: BJP National President JP Nadda reached out to Shiromani Akali Dal's (SAD) chief Sukhbir Singh Badal to secure the party's support for NDA's candidate Droupadi Murmu ahead of Presidential polls. Notably, SAD left the NDA alliance over the contentious farm laws, which the Centre withdrew in 2021. Presidential elections are slated to be held on July 18.

256.title: Good govt being formed: Kesarkar after Shinde becomes Maha CM
256.article_body: After Shiv Sena's Eknath Shinde was sworn-in as Maharashtra's Chief Minister, Shiv Sena MLA Deepak Kesarkar said that a good government was being formed. "Two parties that believe in Hindutva and had parted ways, have come back together," Kesarkar said. "Their tallest leaders...had no reservation about having a Deputy CM from their side," he added.

257.title: UAPA necessary to act against terrorists beheading people: Minister
257.article_body: Laws like the Unlawful Activities (Prevention) Act (UAPA) are "necessary" so that action can be taken against terrorists and those "who behead other people," Union Minister RK Singh said on Thursday. He said that UAPA is to "ensure that people are not killed", and "those who do not listen to diktats of terrorists are not wiped out".

258.title: PM Modi to unveil Alluri Seetarama Raju's statue in Andhra on July 4
258.article_body: Prime Minister Narendra Modi will visit Andhra Pradesh's Bhimavaram town on July 4 to unveil the statue of freedom fighter Alluri Seetarama Raju as part of Azadi Ka Amrit Mahotsav celebrations. Special Chief Secretary Rajat Bhargava on Thursday inspected the arrangements ahead of the event. PM Modi will unveil a 30-foot bronze statue in Bhimavaram Park and address the gathering.

259.title: B'luru's Kempegowda Int'l Airport crosses 250-million passenger mark
259.article_body: The Kempegowda International Airport in Bengaluru has crossed the 250-million passenger mark in its 15th year of establishment, Bangalore International Airport Ltd (BIAL) stated. The airport has also handled two million air traffic movements since its opening in 2008. BIAL said an additional 50 million passengers travelled from the airport in a span of nearly three years despite the pandemic.

260.title: Raj CM holds meeting over law & order situation after Udaipur killing
260.article_body: After meeting the family members of Kanhaiya Lal, who was murdered by two men on June 28 in Udaipur, Rajasthan CM Ashok Gehlot held a meeting with officials over the law and order situation in the state. "Our police did a good job, arrested the accused and found international links...We'll appeal to take this case via fast track," Gehlot said.

261.title: 6 smugglers arrested, 670 gm heroin worth ₹1cr seized in Meghalaya
261.article_body: Six people were arrested in an operation against drug trafficking in Meghalaya and over 670 gm of heroin worth nearly ₹1 crore was seized, a top police officer said on Thursday. Police set up checkpoints in East Jaintia Hills district and arrested two persons, DGP LR Bishnoi said. After their preliminary interrogation, four more persons were arrested, he added.

262.title: 5 arrested in gangrape of woman, 6-yr-old daughter in Uttarakhand
262.article_body: Police on Thursday said they arrested five suspects in sexual assault and gangrape of a six-year-old girl and her mother in Uttarakhand's Haridwar. The girl and her mother were first sexually assaulted by a Haridwar resident who offered them a lift on his motorbike, and were again gangraped by four other accused who hailed from Uttar Pradesh, an official said.

263.title: June monsoon rains in India 8% below average: IMD
263.article_body: According to the India Meteorological Department (IMD), the country has received 8% lesser rainfall than average in June. The IMD has attributed this to 54% lower rainfall as compared to normal in central India. Even though monsoons arrived on the coast of Kerala on May 29, its progress was stalled for over one week.

264.title: NATO declares China a 'security threat' for 1st time: Reports
264.article_body: NATO has listed China as a "security threat" for the first time, stating that the country's ambitions and its "coercive policies" challenge the bloc's "interests, security and values", reports stated. "China is substantially building up its military forces, including nuclear weapons, bullying its neighbours [and] threatening Taiwan," NATO chief Jens Stoltenberg said at the bloc's summit in Madrid.

265.title: 5 protesters killed by security forces during protests: Reports
265.article_body: Five protesters were shot dead by security forces in Sudan on Thursday as thousands protested against the country's military leadership, reports citing a medical group said. Security forces also fired tear gas and water cannon on some of the protesters. Last October, the military led by General Abdel Fattah al-Burhan had toppled Sudan's transitional government.

266.title: EU, New Zealand strike free trade deal after 4 years of talks
266.article_body: After about four years of talks, New Zealand and the European Union (EU) on Thursday announced that they've concluded negotiations on a free trade agreement (FTA). "Trade between us should increase by 30%," European Commission President Ursula von der Leyen tweeted. "We managed to ensure a level playing field for EU investors in New Zealand and vice versa," she said.

267.title: Qatar donates $60 million to Lebanon's army amid economic crisis
267.article_body: Qatar has donated $60 million to Lebanon's army amid a severe economic crisis in the country. Since the crisis erupted in 2019, the Lebanese pound has lost over 90% of its value and tens of thousands have become jobless. Last year, Qatar had announced that it would support the army with 70 tons of food every month for a year.

268.title: Russia open to dialogue on nuclear non-proliferation: Putin
268.article_body: Russia is open to dialogue on strategic stability and nuclear non-proliferation, Russian President Vladimir Putin said on Thursday. However, there aren't any plans for strategic talks between Russia and the US, a Russian government spokesman said. Despite the Russian invasion of Ukraine, both Russia and the US have stressed the importance of maintaining communication on the issue of nuclear arms.

269.title: John Visentin, CEO of printer maker Xerox, passes away aged 59
269.article_body: Printer maker Xerox Holdings Corporation's CEO John Visentin passed away due to complications from a long illness, the company said. "The Xerox family is profoundly saddened by this untimely event and extends its heartfelt condolences to John's wife, his five daughters and his family," the company added. The company has named President and Chief Operating Officer Steve Bandrowczak Interim CEO.

270.title: US Federal Reserve hikes interest rates by 0.75%, biggest increase since 1994
270.article_body: The US Federal Reserve System on Wednesday raised its key interest rate by 0.75%, marking the biggest rate hike made by the US central bank since 1994. "The committee is strongly committed to returning inflation to its 2% objective," the bank's policy-setting committee said. The move will raise US Fed's benchmark short-term rate to a range of 1.5% to 1.75%.

271.title: Not a hiatus, BTS will work as group while focusing on solo careers: BTS' label
271.article_body: The group's label HYBE clarified that BTS isn't going on a 'hiatus' and will work together as a group. "BTS isn't taking a hiatus. Members will be focusing more on solo projects at this time," read a statement from HYBE. This came after BTS, in a video, explained to fans that they need the time to take an extended break.

272.title: Mobile phones, SIM cards, cigarettes seized from 2 Punjab jails
272.article_body: Police said that 14 mobile phones and other prohibited items were recovered during search operations at Punjab's Goindwal Sahib and Amritsar central jails. After the recoveries, seven persons were booked in four separate cases. Apart from mobile phones, two SIM cards, six springs of heaters, 114 bundles of cigarettes and 79 packets of tobacco were recovered during the search operations.

273.title: BJP's countdown has begun: Cong over Rahul Gandhi's ED summons
273.article_body: As protests continue over the Enforcement Directorate's investigation against Rahul Gandhi, Congress' Nana Patole said, "The countdown has begun for the BJP government." The probe against Rahul Gandhi is being carried out "at the behest of the Central government", he added. "Now, the Delhi Police in tandem with the BJP has carried out atrocities on Congress leaders," Patole said.

274.title: India test fires Prithvi, 2nd nuclear-capable missile in 10 days
274.article_body: India carried out another test of its other nuclear-capable missile, Prithvi, nearly 10 days after the routine test of Agni was carried out. "The missile is a proven system and is capable of striking targets with very high precision," an official statement said, adding that the "user training launch successfully validated all operational and technical parameters of the missile".

275.title: Suriya to do a cameo in Akshay's Soorarai Pottru remake, shares post
275.article_body: Actor-filmmaker Suriya on Wednesday shot for the Hindi remake of his film 'Soorarai Pottru'. He will make a cameo appearance in the movie, which is headlined by actor Akshay Kumar. Taking to Twitter, Suriya wrote, "Akshay sir to see you as #VIR was nostalgic! @Sudha_Kongara can see our story beautifully coming alive again...Enjoyed every minute with the team."

276.title: EU signs gas deal with Egypt & Israel to reduce dependency on Russia
276.article_body: European Union (EU) signed a deal with Egypt and Israel to increase liquified natural gas (LNG) sales to EU countries on Wednesday in Cairo. The deal aims to reduce dependency on Russian oil amid Ukraine war. As per deal, Israel will send gas to EU countries via Egypt, which will liquify it for exports via sea, European Commission chief said.

277.title: CET exam centres to be camera-monitored to curb cheating in K'taka
277.article_body: Karnataka Higher Education Minister CN Ashwathnarayan said that students taking the Common Entrance Test (CET) in the state will be monitored by video cameras to limit possible fraud and other malpractices. CET exams are taken by students who wish to enrol in engineering, agriculture, veterinary and pharmaceutical courses. The examination will be held from June 16 to 18.

278.title: Kamla Nagar market will soon be known as pride of Delhi: Sisodia
278.article_body: Delhi Deputy Chief Minister Manish Sisodia inspected Delhi's Kamla Nagar market on Wednesday and said that it will soon be known as the "pride of Delhi". Kamla Nagar market is among the five key markets picked by the city government for redevelopment under its "Rozgar Budget", which aims to generate 20 lakh job opportunities in five years.

279.title: South filmmakers and writers have tremendous talent: Varun Dhawan
279.article_body: Varun Dhawan said south filmmakers and writers have tremendous talent. "SS Rajamouli sir is [at] top of the list. Then there are...many like Surender Reddy is great, the director who made F3 (Anil Ravipudi) he's got great comedy. The director of Pushpa (Sukumar) is amazing," he added. "There was a film which I...loved...It's a Malayalam film called, 'Premam'," Varun said.

280.title: Not having a partner is deepest regret of my life, it's too late now: Karan
280.article_body: Filmmaker Karan Johar said he feels it's too late for him to find a life partner. "I think what a life partner does for you, a parent [or] a child, can never fulfil that," he added. "That's reserved for...your life partner [and] I don't have that. That's a vacant spot in my life and that's my deepest regret," Karan said.

281.title: Yogi govt to now use helicopters to check violence, riots in UP
281.article_body: The Yogi Adityanath-led UP government will now use helicopters to check mob violence, riots and arson in public places. UP government has sought proposals from Airbus Helicopters regarding the use of helicopters in tourism, policing, emergency medical services and law enforcement. The helicopters can also be used for rescue work and for fighting floods, said an Airbus representative.

282.title: 14-yr-old UP girl, mother die in sleep after table fan falls on them
282.article_body: Police said that a 35-year-old woman and her 14-year-old daughter died of electrocution in Uttar Pradesh's Maharajganj on Wednesday. The incident took place when they were sleeping in their house and a table fan fell on them. The two were electrocuted when they touched a bare wire while trying to move the fan, Maharajganj SP Dr Kaustubh said.

283.title: Will keep backing Russia on sovereignty: China's Xi tells Putin
283.article_body: Chinese President told his Russian counterpart Vladimir Putin during a phone conversation on Wednesday that Beijing will keep backing Moscow on sovereignty and security issues. Xi reportedly praised the "good momentum of development" in bilateral ties. Notably, Russia and China opened a new cross-border bridge on June 10 to boost trade amid Western sanctions against Russia for Ukraine war.

284.title: 20-yr-old takes pics, videos of women in Mumbai society; arrested
284.article_body: A 20-year-old man, Sarthak Borade, was arrested by the police for allegedly taking photos and videos of several women in Mumbai's Grant Road area. Police said that a woman, who was noticing his behaviour since last year, confronted him and lodged a police complaint. "We have...recovered the photos and videos from his phone," a police officer said.

285.title: 2 people, including a 9-yr-old, drown in a pond in UP's Bhadohi
285.article_body: Police said that two people, including a minor, drowned in a pond while bathing in Uttar Pradesh's Bhadohi. The deceased have been identified as 19-year-old Sahil Ansari and nine-year-old Vishnu Valmiki. Ansari was bathing in a pond in Kunwarganj village when he began drowning and Valmiki tried to save him but he too drowned, Gyanpur police station SHO said.

286.title: This girl is famous, I'm obsessed: H'wood fashion designer on Uorfi's styling
286.article_body: Hollywood fashion designer, Harris Reed, praised model-actress Uorfi Javed's styling, as according to him she re-created a look from one of his collections. Taking to Instagram, Harris shared a reel and wrote, "This girl is clearly very famous who remade one of my show looks and has 45 million views. It is very obsessive and I'm really obsessed."

287.title: Which are the world's most expensive cities to live in?
287.article_body: Shanghai has topped the list of the world's most expensive cities to live in, as per Julius Baer Group's 2022 global wealth and lifestyle report. London, the capital of the United Kingdom, has been ranked second. Taipei, the capital of Taiwan, is at number three in the list, while Hong Kong and Singapore have been ranked fourth and fifth.

288.title: Beijing revokes licence of bar linked to latest COVID-19 outbreak
288.article_body: Beijing has revoked the licence of a 24-hour bar that is believed to be at the centre of a cluster of over 320 COVID-19 cases across several districts. A criminal case has been filed against the bar's owner for "breaching the law and conducting dishonest acts". Over 2,000 COVID-19 cases have been reported in Beijing since late April.

289.title: Rocketry script was torn into shreds, took me 1.5 yrs to rework it: Madhavan
289.article_body: R Madhavan, who made his directorial debut with 'Rocketry: The Nambi Effect', revealed that he had to redo his entire script after he spoke to the subject of his film, Nambi Narayanan. The actor-director said after that conversation, he could see his "script being torn to shreds" and it took him "another one and a half years to rework it".

290.title: Crypto market value falls below $900 bn as Bitcoin drops to $20,000 level
290.article_body: The value of the global crypto market fell to under $900 billion on Wednesday from a peak of $2.97 trillion in November 2020. Bitcoin, the world's largest crypto by market capitalisation, also fell 7.8% to $20,289, its lowest value since December 2020. Bitcoin has dropped around 30% in value since Friday and lost over half of its value this year.

291.title: Tripura Cong locks ED office in protest against summons to Rahul
291.article_body: The Tripura unit of Congress on Wednesday locked the local ED office in protest against the interrogation of party leader Rahul Gandhi in connection with the National Herald money laundering case. Congress leader Sudip Roy Barman said the summons is a means to harass Gandhi, adding that PM Narendra Modi has "nothing to show people".

292.title: Delhi Police tore my clothes, removed my shoes during protest: Cong's Jothimani
292.article_body: Congress MP Jothimani has alleged that Delhi Police personnel assaulted her and tore her clothes while she was protesting against ED summons to Rahul Gandhi. Sharing a video online, she alleged, "They removed my shoes and carried me like a criminal." Jothimani added, "There are eight women on this bus and we repeatedly asked for water but they refused."

293.title: Sri Lanka to reserve fuel for cremations amid economic crisis
293.article_body: Sri Lanka has proposed to reserve a portion of fuel for cremation purposes, in accordance with Buddhist customs, amid shortage of fuel and other essentials in the country due to economic crisis. "We will supply [fuel to] bulk users that [are] hotels, hospitals and crematoriums," PM Ranil Wickremesinghe said. Sri Lanka will introduce a fuel rationing scheme from July onwards.

294.title: Rahul Gandhi questioned by ED for 3rd day, summoned again on Friday
294.article_body: Congress leader Rahul Gandhi has been summoned by the Enforcement Directorate (ED) for further questioning on Friday in connection with the National Herald case. Rahul appeared before the Enforcement Directorate for the third consecutive day on Wednesday. He arrived at the ED Headquarters in Delhi at around 11.35 am on Wednesday.

295.title: Anil Kapoor remembers his mother, says 'She used to make clothes for me'
295.article_body: During a contestant's performance on 'Superstar Singer 2', Anil Kapoor remembered his relationship with his mother. "Mani and his mother have taken me back to my childhood. They've made me recall the machine (sewing machine) we used to own," he added. "The way you've made this shirt for him, my mother also used to make clothes for me," Anil said.

296.title: Hardik Pandya named captain as India squad for T20I series against Ireland announced
296.article_body: The All-India Senior Selection Committee on Wednesday announced a 17-member Team India squad for the two-match T20I series against Ireland. Hardik Pandya has been named captain of the squad, with several senior members of the squad being rested. Sanju Samson and Suryakumar Yadav have also been included in the squad. Meanwhile, Rahul Tripathi has received his maiden Team India call-up.

297.title: Groom dances, takes selfies in moving open roof Audi in UP; fined ₹2 lakh
297.article_body: A video of a groom dancing and taking selfies in a moving open roof Audi amid heavy traffic during a wedding procession in Uttar Pradesh's Muzaffarnagar went viral online. The video showed his friends accompanying him in Audi and other cars and hanging out of windows and sun roofs of their cars. Muzaffarnagar Police said they've fined nine vehicles ₹2,02,000.

298.title: Nomination process for July 18 Presidential election begins
298.article_body: The Election Commission of India on Wednesday issued a gazette notification for the 16th Presidential election. With this, the process to file nominations for the July 18 election has begun. The nominations can be filed till June 29 and the scrutiny of the papers will be held on June 30, while the votes will be counted on July 21.

299.title: Will reduce effectiveness of armed forces: Rahul on 'Agnipath' scheme
299.article_body: Congress leader Rahul Gandhi on Wednesday reacted to the new military recruitment model 'Agnipath', stating that it will reduce the 'operational effectiveness of the armed forces'. "The BJP government must stop compromising the dignity, traditions, valour and discipline of our forces," he tweeted. 'Agnipath' proposes to employ aspirants (below officer rank) in the military for four years.

300.title: PURE EV scooter catches fire while charging in Gujarat; video surfaces
300.article_body: A PURE EV scooter caught fire while it was plugged in for charging in Gujarat's Patan. A video showing the e-scooter on fire outside a house also surfaced on social media. Last month, a PURE EV scooter caught fire in Hyderabad after stopping suddenly. The startup had recalled 2,000 e-scooters in April this year after incidents of fire were reported.

301.title: Won't give up on my hope of working with Kajol: Kichcha post his Twitter debate
301.article_body: Kannada actor Kichcha Sudeepa said he hopes that his recent Hindi vs South debate with Ajay Devgn does not affect his dream of working with the actor's wife and actress Kajol. "I had this great dream of working with Kajol ma'am...[it]...fell flat with this debate," he added. "I'll never give up on my hope of working with Kajol," Kichcha said.

302.title: High Court judge's daughter arrested for murder of shooter Sippy Sidhu in Chandigarh
302.article_body: Kalyani Singh, a Himachal Pradesh High Court judge Justice's daughter, has been arrested over the murder of national-level shooter and lawyer Sippy Sidhu in Chandigarh in 2015. "There was a delay in the arrest but I still believe in law," said Sippy's mother. She told the police that Kalyani called Sippy to a park on the day he was killed.

303.title: Russia's territorial ambitions are from Warsaw to Sofia: Ukraine Prez
303.article_body: Ukrainian President Volodymyr Zelenskyy said on Wednesday that Russia's territorial ambitions aren't limited to Ukrainian cities but rather stretch to capital cities of Poland and Bulgaria, Warsaw and Sofia. He made these remarks while virtually addressing Czech Republic's parliament, seeking additional sanctions by EU against Russia. EU has adopted six rounds of sanctions against Russia so far.

304.title: Singer B Praak's baby passes away at the time of birth
304.article_body: Singer B Praak on Wednesday shared that his baby passed away at the time of birth. "It's the most painful phase we are going through as parents. We would like to thank all the doctors and the staff for their endless efforts," he said. The singer and his wife Meera Bachan announced in April they were expecting their second child.

305.title: Surat Cong, villagers complain about water pollution by textile mills
305.article_body: Congress leaders along with residents of Parab village in Surat complained to district collector and Gujarat Pollution Control Board (GPCB) officials about untreated waste being discharged from textile mills into Kadodara creek in Kamrej. "The industrial units have violated pollution norms," Darshan Naik, former LoP in Surat district panchayat said. Parab village has a population of 2,000 people.

306.title: Pics show Varun, Kiara eating inside Mumbai metro; people ask 'Is it allowed?'
306.article_body: Anil Kapoor, Varun Dhawan and Kiara Advani took a ride in the Mumbai metro on Tuesday amid promotions of 'Jug Jugg Jeeyo'. After visuals of Varun and Kiara eating inside the metro surfaced, an Instagram user commented, "Is eating allowed inside the Metro?" while another comment read, "Are rules meant only for common people?"

307.title: Forest fire destroys rare chilgoza trees in Himachal's Kinnaur
307.article_body: The forest fire in the high-altitude Kinnaur district of Himachal Pradesh raging since the past few days has been brought under control, but has destroyed hundreds of rare chilgoza pine and juniper trees. "The fire affected 2,000 bighas," Kinnaur Deputy Commissioner said. The chilgoza pine nuts, consumed locally and sold abroad, are a source of livelihood for Jangi village residents.

308.title: Bad sign for healthy democracy: Cong's Pilot after being detained
308.article_body: Congress leader Sachin Pilot, after being detained for trying to enter the party office, said that his detention was a bad sign for a healthy democracy. "I don't know what next they plan to do with us. This sort of detainment has never happened before. This behaviour in a civil society is just not done," he said.

309.title: This is cute, I had no idea: PhonePe CEO on reports of company filing for IPO
309.article_body: Hours after reports came out that PhonePe is considering raising funds through an initial public offering (IPO), its Founder and CEO Sameer Nigam said he had no idea about it. "This is cute. I had no idea my own company is filing an IPO," he wrote. Reports said the company is seeking a valuation of $8-10 billion.

310.title: Supreme Court to hear plea against demolitions by UP govt tomorrow
310.article_body: Supreme Court will on Thursday hear a petition seeking directions to the Uttar Pradesh government to follow rules while carrying out demolitions in the state. The petition was filed by Jamiat Ulama-i-Hind. It sought due notice and opportunity of hearing to each of the affected persons. This comes days after authorities demolished the house of Prayagraj violence accused Javed Mohammed.

311.title: Thought dad died in Ghulam, I started howling: Deepak Tijori's daughter
311.article_body: Actor Deepak Tijori's daughter Samara Tijori spoke about the time when she thought her father died after she watched a scene featuring him in Aamir Khan-starrer 'Ghulam'. Samara said, "I was 5-6. I saw that train sequence, and that's a...well-cut sequence, you actually feel someone's hurt." "I saw...and I thought my dad died. I started crying and howling," she added.

312.title: Police use water cannons on BJP workers protesting against Kerala CM
312.article_body: Kerala Police used water cannons and tear gas to stop BJP Yuva Morcha members as they protested against CM Pinarayi Vijayan, demanding his resignation over the gold smuggling case. The BJP workers staged a protest outside the Secretariat in Thiruvananthapuram. The protests came after the prime accused in the gold smuggling case, Swapna Suresh, claimed CM's involvement in the scam.

313.title: Sharad Pawar refuses to contest for Presidential post
313.article_body:
NCP chief Sharad Pawar on Wednesday refused to contest for the upcoming Presidential election. 
"I sincerely appreciate the leaders of opposition parties for suggesting my name as a candidate for the election of the President of India, at the meeting held in Delhi. However I like to state that I have humbly declined the proposal of my candidature," Pawar said.

314.title: Mumbai sees 33% rise in daily COVID-19 cases to 2,293, highest since Jan 23
314.article_body: Mumbai reported 2,293 new COVID-19 cases on Wednesday, which is the highest since January 23 this year. This is a 33% rise in COVID-19 cases from Tuesday's 1,724 cases. The city also reported one death due to COVID-19 in the last 24 hours, while the positivity rate stood at 13.37% and the number of active cases rose to 12,341.

315.title: Production of fuel more than sufficient to take care of demand surge, clarifies govt
315.article_body: Dismissing rumours of a shortage, government clarified that production of petrol and diesel in India is more than sufficient to take care of any demand surge. "This unprecedented growth has created some temporary logistics issues at local level. Oil Companies have geared up to tackle these issues by increasing...stocks," said government. This follows reports of fuel shortages in various states.

316.title: Panvel civic body issues notice to remove illegal hoardings: Report
316.article_body: The Panvel civic body has issued a notice to remove all unauthorised banners, posters, flex boards or hoardings across the city, reports said. The civic body warned of stern action if the banners are not taken down. It has also asked political parties and citizens to take permission before putting up hoardings in public places or on building rooftops.

317.title: Appoint nodal officers to check waterlogging issues in Pune: BJP
317.article_body: BJP leaders have asked the Pune Municipal Corporation (PMC) to appoint nodal officers to review the waterlogging situation in the city as part of the administration's pre-monsoon arrangements. "The civic body needs to...do traffic management to avoid chaos during the monsoon," BJP leader Sandeep Khardekar said. PMC earlier claimed that it had cleared 76 waterlogging-prone spots in the city.

318.title: Sales tax official caught while accepting ₹20 lakh bribe in Thane
318.article_body: An Assistant Commissioner of sales tax department from Thane was arrested by Anti Corruption Bureau (ACB) for accepting a bribe of ₹20 lakh from a hotelier. The accused has been identified as 42-year-old Dhananjay Janardhan Shirshat. "The complainant...told us that Dhananjay...demanded ₹30 lakh for the past assessment and for getting new GST number for his hotel," an ACB official said.

319.title: BESCOM to add 140 EV chargers in the next 6 months in Bengaluru
319.article_body: The Bangalore Electricity Supply Company (BESCOM) has said it will add 140 EV chargers in the next six months in order to strengthen the electric vehicles' charging network. BESCOM MD P Rajendra Cholan said that tenders have been invited to set up 1,000 EV charging stations across Karnataka. "Currently, BESCOM is operating 136 EV chargers in Bengaluru city," Cholan added.

320.title: Delhi sees a 23% jump in new COVID cases to 1,375; positivity rate rises to 7.01%
320.article_body: Delhi on Wednesday reported 1,375 new COVID-19 cases, a rise of 23% from 1,118 cases recorded the previous day. The city's COVID-19 positivity rate rose to 7.01% from Tuesday's 6.5%. Delhi reported zero deaths due to COVID-19 in the last 24 hours, while the active cases stood at 3,643, as per a health bulletin.

321.title: Sonu Sood helps Indian man stuck in Thailand, says 'Had to bring you back'
321.article_body: Actor Sonu Sood rescued a man stuck in Thailand. Recently, a person named Sahil Khan took to Twitter seeking the actor's help. Replying to him, Sood stated that he'll send the tickets. On June 13, Sahil tweeted, "Finally reached India...true gem @SonuSood." Sood retweeted the post and wrote, "You're my Indian brother, had to bring you back."

322.title: Gujarat woman stabs husband to death to save son from being thrashed
322.article_body: A 40-year-old woman was arrested on Tuesday for allegedly stabbing her 45-year-old husband to death in order to stop him from beating their son. The woman, a resident of Gujarat's Ahmedabad, used a kitchen knife to attack her husband on Monday night. The deceased was going to thrash his son as he wasn't able to access a few TV channels.

323.title: Which are India's 10 most valuable companies as per Hurun list?
323.article_body: Reliance Industries with a value of ₹18,87,881 crore is India's most valuable company, according to Burgundy Private Hurun India 500- Special Report. It's followed by Tata Consultancy Services, HDFC Bank, Infosys, ICICI Bank, Adani Green Energy, Bharti Airtel, Housing Development Finance Corporation, Bajaj Finance and Kotak Mahindra Bank. The total value of these companies is ₹71.8 lakh crore.

324.title: Sidharth Malhotra goes on a bike ride with Sadhguru, shares pics
324.article_body: Taking to Instagram, actor Sidharth Malhotra shared few pictures of a bike ride with Sadhguru for 'Save Soil Movement'. In one picture, Sidharth and Sadhguru could be seen sitting on bikes and posing for the camera. In the photos, Sidharth is seen wearing a white T-shirt, while Sadhguru donned a yellow t-shirt with Save Our Soil written on it.

325.title: PM Modi to visit his mother in Guj on her 100th birthday on June 18
325.article_body: PM Modi is likely to visit Gujarat on June 18 to visit his mother, who will be turning 100 that day. A celebration has also been organised at the Modi's native town of Vadnagar in the Mehsana district by Hiraba's (PM's mother) sons in the evening. "Hiraba's presence at the event will depend on her health," said Prahlad Modi.

326.title: Bihar woman constable thrown off moving train while resisting thieves
326.article_body: A woman constable of Bihar Police was on Wednesday thrown off a moving train while she was resisting a theft bid in the state's Katihar district. "Around four miscreants tried to snatch my purse and mobile phone and when I resisted their bid, they pushed me off," the injured constable said in the hospital.

327.title: Ambala tourist, instructor killed as paraglider crashes in Himachal
327.article_body: A tourist from Ambala and a paragliding instructor were killed after their paraglider collided with a hill soon after take-off in Himachal Pradesh's Kullu district. The incident took place in the Dobhi area of the district. Post-mortem is being done in a nearby hospital, Kullu Superintendent of Police (SP) Gurdev Chand Sharma said.

328.title: The Fuel Delivery to soon offer doorstep delivery of CNG in Mumbai
328.article_body: Energy distribution startup The Fuel Delivery will soon begin doorstep delivery of CNG to customers in Mumbai. The service, which will start from places like Sion and Mahape initially, will be extended across the city soon. The startup has signed a Letter of Intent with Mahanagar Gas Limited (MGL) for the round-the-clock service which will begin in next three months.

329.title: Prayagraj police to put up posters of violence accused on roadsides
329.article_body: Police in Uttar Pradesh's Prayagraj will put up posters of people allegedly involved in the June 10 violence on roadsides and in public places to identify them, officials said. Police will also circulate these posters on social media platforms and their houses will also be attached. The violence broke out after Friday prayers over remarks against Prophet Muhammad.

330.title: Fire breaks out at commercial building in Pune, no casualties reported
330.article_body: A fire broke out in the basement of a commercial building in Pune's Shivajinagar area on Wednesday morning. No casualties were reported due to the fire, which damaged a set of documents of an automobile sales company. Officials suspect that a short circuit in the electrical system in basement could have led to the blaze.

331.title: WHO explores reports of monkeypox virus in semen
331.article_body: The WHO is looking into reports that the monkeypox virus is present in the semen of patients, to check the possibility that the disease could be sexually transmitted, WHO's Catherine Smallwood said. "This may have been something that we were unaware of in this disease before," she said, adding that most frequent mode of transmission is associated with skin-to-skin contact.

332.title: DOGE founder shares 'death knocking' meme to suggest real estate crash, Musk says 'True'
332.article_body: Dogecoin Co-founder Billy Markus has suggested that real estate may be the next thing to collapse after stock and crypto markets. He posted a meme with death opening doors in turn and leaving pools of blood behind each of them. Tesla CEO and the world's richest man Elon Musk replied to the tweet by writing, "True."

333.title: 2.4 mn hectares of winter crops won't be harvested due to war: Ukraine
333.article_body: Ukraine's Agriculture Ministry said around 2.4 million hectares of winter crops with a total value of $1.435 billion will remain unharvested in the country because of Russia's invasion. So far, the agriculture sector has suffered losses of $4.292 billion because of the invasion, it added. Some 92,000 cows and 258,000 pigs have been killed in areas affected by fighting.

334.title: Musk-owned SpaceX's Starship will be ready for orgital flight in July
334.article_body: SpaceX's Starship vehicle will be ready for orbital flight next month, said Founder and CEO Elon Musk in a tweet on Tuesday. "I was in the high bay and mega bay late last night reviewing progress," Musk said in response to a query regarding Starship's orbital flight. "We'll have a second Starship stack ready to fly in August," Musk added.

335.title: Aaditya Thackeray, Shiv Sena leaders perform aarti in Ayodhya's ISKCON Temple
335.article_body: Maharashtra Minister Aaditya Thackeray, along with other Shiv Sena leaders, performed aarti at ISKCON Temple in Ayodhya's Ramnagar on Wednesday. "Recalling the relationship between Hindu Hriday Samrat Balasaheb Thackeray and ISKCON Mumbai," Thackeray tweeted while sharing a video of the aarti. "I am grateful for the invitation and love to visit ISKCON Ramnagar," his tweet further read.

336.title: Ryanair drops Afrikaans nationality test for S Africans amid backlash
336.article_body: Ryanair has dropped a requirement for South African passengers to prove their nationality by taking a test in Afrikaans language. This comes after the move, which was aimed at weeding out fraudulent South African passports, received backlash from the country's government. Afrikaans is spoken by around 12% of South African population and was linked to apartheid era in the country.

337.title: Opposition parties adopt resolution to field common candidate for Presidential election
337.article_body: The leaders of several Opposition parties on Wednesday adopted a resolution to field common candidate for the upcoming Presidential election, TMC chief Mamata Banerjee said. "This is a good beginning. We sat together after several months, and we will do it again," she added. The parties included Congress, Shiv Sena, NCP, SP, PDP, National Conference, RJD and DMK among others.

338.title: Aamir to host reunion party for the team as Lagaan completes 21 yrs: Reports
338.article_body: Aamir Khan will reportedly host a reunion party at his home as Lagaan completed 21 years. To celebrate the legacy of the film, the cast will reunite at Aamir's residence today. Last year, the team had a virtual reunion to celebrate 20 years of the film. Meanwhile, on the professional front, Aamir will be next seen in 'Laal Singh Chaddha'.

339.title: I've aged, I don't show my aggression unless a batter provokes me: Chahal
339.article_body: India spinner Yuzvendra Chahal, on being asked about his subdued wicket celebrations by opener Ruturaj Gaikwad, jokingly said, "Now that I have aged, I don't show my aggression unless a batter provokes me." He added, "It's just a normal celebration...There are friends who are batting at the other end." Chahal registered figures of 3/20 in the third South Africa T20I.

340.title: France captures senior Islamic State member in Mali
340.article_body: French troops in Mali have captured a senior member of the Islamic State militant group, French Armed Forces Ministry said. Oumeya Albakaye was captured on the intervening night of June 11-12 close to the border between Mali and Niger, it added. This comes as France prepares to complete its withdrawal from Mali, where it has been fighting ISIS since 2013.

341.title: Gangsters were born under previous govts in Punjab: AAP's Kejriwal
341.article_body: AAP's Arvind Kejriwal on Wednesday backed current law and order situation in Punjab while speaking at an event in Jalandhar. "I ask...Opposition, has [Punjab CM Bhagwant Mann] brought gangsters with him? These gangsters were born under...previous governments," he said. Kejriwal's comments come amid Opposition's uproar over rising crimes in Punjab following Congress leader Sidhu Moosewala's murder.

342.title: 25-yr-old IAF officer kills self at hostel in Madhya Pradesh
342.article_body: A 25-year-old Indian Air Force (IAF) officer allegedly died by suicide by hanging from a ceiling fan in his hostel room in Madhya Pradesh's Gwalior city on Wednesday. The deceased, identified as Jaidutt Singh, was a flying officer posted in the engineering branch at Maharajpura Air Base in the city. Singh was transferred to Gwalior this year, an official said.

343.title: NZ's Kyle Jamieson ruled out of third England Test with back injury
343.article_body: New Zealand pacer Kyle Jamieson has been ruled out of the third Test against England due to a back injury he picked during the second Test. "Jamieson will return home after an MRI scan revealed a stress-reaction to his lower left-back," said New Zealand's cricket board. Jamieson didn't bowl during England's second innings on Day 5 of the second Test.

344.title: BJP expels Rajasthan MLA for cross-voting in Rajya Sabha polls
344.article_body: BJP on Tuesday expelled MLA Shobharani Kushwah from Rajasthan's Dholpur constituency for cross-voting in the recently-held Rajya Sabha elections. Kushwah was earlier suspended and served a show-cause notice for going against party orders. Notably, the BJP had asked its members to vote for independent candidate Subhash Chandra. However, Kushwah voted for Congress' Pramod Tiwari in the elections.

345.title: Woman, minor sons die after jumping in front of moving train in Delhi
345.article_body: A woman and her minor sons died after they allegedly jumped in front of a moving train in Delhi. Reports said that the incident took place at the Holambi Kalan railway station on Tuesday. The identity of the deceased is yet to be revealed. Reports also said that the police have taken possession of the bodies.

346.title: UP man impersonates Assam Crime Branch official, extorts money from suspects
346.article_body: Assam Police arrested a man from Guwahati’s Beltola area on the charges of impersonating a crime branch inspector to extort money from suspects in criminal cases. The accused, who is from UP, received money from suspects on the promise of influencing the probe and getting them exonerated, SP, Assam CID, Pranab Jyoti Goswami, said.

347.title: Haryana board declares Class 12 results, top 3 ranks secured by girls
347.article_body: The Board of School Education Haryana announced Class 12 results on Wednesday. KCM Senior Secondary School Rohtak's Kajal topped the exam by securing 498 out of 500 marks and the second and third ranks were also bagged by girls.
