As many as 87.08% of the students cleared the exam. Girls' pass percentage was 90.51%, while it was 83.96% for boys.

348.title: Latest rankings for T20I batters out, India's Ishan Kishan jumps 68 spots
348.article_body: The ICC on Wednesday announced the latest rankings for T20I batters. India's Ishan Kishan jumped 68 spots to break into the top 10. He is now ranked seventh with 689 rating points and is the only Indian batter in the top 10. Further, Pakistan's Mohammad Rizwan jumped a spot to be ranked second with 794 rating points.

349.title: Quit acting after my debut film which was a super-duper hit: Suchitra
349.article_body: Discussing her decision to quit acting for a few years, actress Suchitra Krishnamoorthi said, "I quit after my debut film ['Kabhi Haan Kabhi Naa' which starred Shah Rukh Khan and]...was a super-duper hit." Suchitra added her parents and ex-husband, director Shekhar Kapur who directed the original 'Mr India' didn't want her to act which is why she gave up acting.

350.title: Cong's Sachin Pilot detained amid protests over Rahul’s questioning by ED
350.article_body: Congress leader Sachin Pilot was detained on his way to Congress headquarters on Wednesday amid protests over Rahul Gandhi’s questioning by the ED. Gandhi appeared before the ED for the third consecutive day today in connection with the National Herald case. Earlier today, Congress workers and leaders protesting against ED questioning were detained by the police outside the AICC office.

351.title: 60-yr-old arrested for sexually assaulting minor girl in Hyd
351.article_body: Hyderabad Police arrested a 60-year-old man on Tuesday night for allegedly misbehaving with a minor girl. According to the police officer, the accused runs a general store and touched the minor inappropriately when she had gone to purchase some products. The girl, who was in a state of shock, informed her parents, following which a case was registered.

352.title: Photographer recreates pic of Arctic region after 104 years to show melting glacier
352.article_body: Photographer Neill Drake has recreated a 1918 photo of Blomstrandbreen Glacier in the Arctic region to show how much of it has melted. "I knew that the message that this photo represented meant a whole lot more than just how accurate the boat position and mountain peaks were," he said. He added the photo was meant to make people uncomfortable.

353.title: How will BCCI distribute ₹48,390-crore fetched from IPL media rights?
353.article_body: BCCI will distribute half of ₹48,390-crore fetched from IPL media rights between the eight original franchises. The remaining half will be shared with players and state associations. As per a report, 26% of the remaining half will be distributed among domestic and international players, while 4% has been earmarked for staff salaries and the state associations will get remaining 70%.

354.title: Dad jokes about me marrying Telugu guy, don't think I'll wed soon: Sai Pallavi
354.article_body: Actress Sai Pallavi said that her father jokes about her marrying a Telugu guy. Talking about her marriage plans, she said, "I've got so used to speaking Telugu at home." "I don't think it'll happen anytime soon. Right now, I'm happy being alone and I'm trying to know about myself more. I'm on that journey," she added.

355.title: Ruthless suppression of Cong's protests is blot on our democracy: Tharoor
355.article_body: Congress leader Shashi Tharoor on Wednesday said the "ruthless" suppression of the Congress party’s protests is a "blot" on our democracy. His statement came as Rahul Gandhi appeared before the ED for the third consecutive day today. Congress workers and leaders protesting against ED questioning were also detained by the police outside the AICC office earlier today.

356.title: PM Modi to address public meeting in Hyderabad on July 3
356.article_body: Prime Minister Narendra Modi will address a public meeting in Hyderabad on July 3 after the culmination of the BJP's national executive meeting in the city. Initially, it was proposed that PM Modi would take up a roadshow in the city. The BJP's national executive meeting will be held on July 2 and 3.

357.title: Kangana's 'Dhaakad', made at ₹85 crore budget, earns only ₹2.58 crore: Report
357.article_body: Kangana Ranaut's 'Dhaakad', which was made on an estimated budget of ₹85 crore, managed to earn a lifetime collection of ₹2.58 crore at the box office in India, as per Bollywood Hungama. The report added that the producers are facing ₹78 crore loss. It said that the producers will have to now sell satellite and digital rights at throwaway prices.

358.title: Anupam Kher posts video of travelling on Purvanchal Expressway, says 'Like US highways'
358.article_body: Actor Anupam Kher on Wednesday shared a video of his travel on the Purvanchal Expressway on his way from Lucknow to Varanasi on Twitter. He wrote, "Travelling on Purvanchal Express inaugurated recently by PM Narendra Modi is like any European or American freeways/highways. Makes me feel so proud." He added, "Kudos to Nitin Gadkari ji, Yogi Adityanath and entire team."

359.title: Natalie's character not at most exciting version in previous Thor films: Taika
359.article_body: 'Thor: Love and Thunder' director Taika Waititi, speaking about Natalie Portman's character in previous 'Thor' films, said, "It's...not the most exciting version of the female character that we want from these films." He added he talked to Natalie about changing her character in 'Thor: Love and Thunder'. He said he wanted to make her character adventurous and fun.

360.title: 4, including 2 minors, killed after SUV collides with tanker in UP
360.article_body: Four people, including two minors, were killed and two others sustained injuries when an SUV collided with a tanker on Purvanchal Expressway in Uttar Pradesh's Sultanpur district. The incident took place on Tuesday night when the car was on its way to Lucknow from Ballia, police said. Injured persons have been admitted to a hospital for treatment, an official said.

361.title: Thailand opposition parties file no-confidence motion against PM
361.article_body: Thailand's opposition parties filed a no-confidence motion against PM Prayut Chan-o-cha and 10 cabinet ministers. They have accused the leaders of corruption, economic mismanagement and undermining democracy. "[Prayut] is a leader that has a flawed thinking, likes to cling to power, does not respect the rule of law, lacks morals and failed in managing state affairs," said an opposition leader.

362.title: Joe Root becomes world number one Test batter, 2 Indians in top 10
362.article_body: The ICC today released the latest rankings for Test batters, with Joe Root reclaiming the top spot. Root is now on top of the rankings with 897 rating points. He overtook Marnus Labuschagne, who has 892 rating points. Eighth-ranked Rohit Sharma and 10th-ranked Virat Kohli are the two Indians in top 10.

363.title: Akshay Kumar is very passionate about 'Oh My God 2': Yami Gautam
363.article_body: Actress Yami Gautam, speaking about working with Akshay Kumar in 'Oh My God 2', has said, "He's a very good producer also...someone who is very passionate about this film." "When I was given the narration, I could feel that he really wants to make it with the right team," she added. Yami also called Pankaj Tripathi a "fantastic actor".

364.title: BJP govt making armed forces its laboratory for experiments: Priyanka
364.article_body: A day after the Union government announced the 'Agnipath' scheme for recruitment to the armed forces, Congress leader Priyanka Gandhi Vadra asked why the BJP was making the armed forces its laboratory for experiments. "Soldiers serving the army for several years, does the government see this as a burden?" Priyanka's Twitter post read.

365.title: Not political, it's for religious purpose: Aaditya Thackeray on Ayodhya visit
365.article_body: Maharashtra Minister Aaditya Thackeray on Wednesday visited Ayodhya to offer prayers at the Ram temple and said his visit to the temple is not for political benefits. "Shiv Sena leaders and I've visited here for religious purpose...there's no political benefit," he said. Sena leaders Sanjay Raut and Eknath Shinde along with over 1,000 Shiv Sainiks reached Ayodhya for Aaditya's visit.

366.title: Duplicate Surf Excel manufacturing unit busted in Greater Noida
366.article_body: A factory manufacturing fake Surf Excel detergent powder was busted in Greater Noida and one person was arrested in connection with the case, police said on Wednesday. Besides raw material, over 10,000 sachets of 80-gm weight having the label of Hindustan Unilever's Surf Excel brand and over 32,000 unprinted sachets of the same size were seized, a police spokesperson said.

367.title: Ukraine suffering painful losses, needs anti-missile weapons: Zelenskyy
367.article_body: Ukrainian forces are suffering painful losses in fighting Russian troops in the east of the country, Ukraine's President Volodymyr Zelenskyy said on Tuesday. He added that Ukraine now needs modern anti-missile weapons and there could be no justification for partner countries to delay delivery. Zelenskyy also said that some Russian rockets are evading Ukrainian defences and causing casualties.

368.title: Hate being categorised as an actor, dislike being put in a box: Radhika
368.article_body: Sharing her opinion on actors being categorised on the basis of mediums they work in, actress Radhika Apte said she "hates" being categorised, adding she doesn't like being "put in a box". "That doesn't mean I can stop people from doing that," stated Radhika. Actor Vikrant Massey said being categorised as an actor bothers him, adding it is unfair.

369.title: Cong to gherao all Raj Bhawans over claims of police entering party office
369.article_body: Congress leader Randeep Singh Surjewala said the party will gherao all Raj Bhawans across India on Thursday to protest against Delhi Police entering Congress' Delhi headquarters and beating up workers. Several Congress leaders and workers have been protesting outside the party office and ED headquarters since Monday. They're protesting over summons to Rahul Gandhi in National Herald case.

370.title: Send questions via mail: Naveen Jindal to Thane police over Prophet remarks
370.article_body: Expelled BJP leader Naveen Kumar Jindal failed to appear before Bhiwandi Police in Maharashtra's Thane on Wednesday in a case over his alleged derogatory tweets against Prophet Muhammad. Jindal sent a mail to police, saying he was unwell and medically unfit to travel. He asked police to send him questions and he'll respond to them via email through his lawyer.

371.title: Harshal has done everything he can to be in India's squad for T20 WC: Irfan
371.article_body: Ex-India cricketer Irfan Pathan has said pacer Harshal Patel has done everything he can to be part of India's squad for the T20 World Cup later this year. "I understand playing in Australia...you need extra pace...[but] he has been outstanding as far as variation is concerned," stated Irfan. Harshal registered figures of 4/25 in the third T20I against South Africa.

372.title: Kejriwal, Mann flag off Jalandhar-Delhi airport Volvo bus service
372.article_body: Delhi CM Arvind Kejriwal and his Punjab counterpart Bhagwant Mann on Wednesday flagged off a government-run Volvo bus service connecting Jalandhar to Delhi's IGI airport. The ceremony, which took place at Jalandhar's Shaheed Bhagat Singh Interstate Bus Terminal, was also attended by Punjab Transport Minister Laljit Bhullar. "This marks...end of private transport mafia in Punjab," AAP tweeted.

373.title: Canada ends COVID-19 vaccine mandate for domestic, int'l travel
373.article_body: The Canadian government has announced that it will end COVID-19 vaccine requirement for domestic and international travel from June 20. The decision comes following concerns over hours-long delays at airports. Though the vaccine mandate has been withdrawn for trains and flights, the passengers would still be required to wear masks while travelling.

374.title: Centre will pay hefty price for suppressing Rahul Gandhi’s voice: CM Baghel
374.article_body: Chhattisgarh Chief Minister Bhupesh Baghel criticised BJP-led Central government over ED's probe against Congress leader Rahul Gandhi in the National Herald case. The centre will have to pay a hefty price for attempting to suppress Gandhi's voice, Baghel said. "Be it GST, demonetisation, COVID mismanagement...unemployment...Gandhi has been raising...voice against every important issue," he added.

375.title: FIR against Maha Cong leader for derogatory comments about PM Modi
375.article_body: An FIR was registered in Nagpur against Maharashtra Congress leader Sheikh Hussain for allegedly using derogatory language against PM Narendra Modi. "I've not made any personal attack against the PM, only used an idiom in my speech. I spoke in favour of the party. I've not said anything I regret or need to apologise for," he said.

376.title: This is huge, I feel such pride: Janhvi Kapoor on Brahmastra's trailer
376.article_body: Janhvi Kapoor reacted to Brahmastra's trailer that was released earlier today. Taking to Instagram Stories, Janhvi wrote, "This is huge!!! A first for Hindi cinema. Feel such pride to finally see a glimpse of this spectacular vision!! Truly a world like we've never seen before." Alia Bhatt shared the trailer on Instagram and wrote, "A piece of our hearts, 'Brahmastra'."

377.title: Man puts salt in eyes & gets blindfolded, paints Sonu Sood's pic; actor reacts
377.article_body: Actor Sonu Sood shared a video of a man who allegedly put salt in his eyes and got blindfolded before painting the actor's picture at an event. In the video, the man can be seen painting Sood's picture upside down. Several people can be seen looking while the man paints the picture. "What wonderful man," Sonu wrote on Twitter.

378.title: 350-pound bear euthanised after attacking 3-yr-old girl, her mother
378.article_body: A 350-pound black bear was euthanised after ripping into a family's tent and injuring a mother and her three-year-old daughter in the US. The bear allegedly tore through the sleeping family's tent at 5:20 am on Sunday and scratched the mother and the daughter, causing superficial head lacerations. The child's father managed to scare off the bear after several attempts.

379.title: Latest rankings for ODI batters out, Kohli drops out of top 2 for first time after 5 years
379.article_body: The ICC today released the latest rankings for ODI batters, with Virat Kohli dropping to the third position. It is for the first time in five years that Kohli has dropped out of the first two positions. Pakistan captain Babar Azam remains at the number one spot, while his compatriot Imam-ul-Haq is now the world number two ODI batter.

380.title: Video shows Varun, Kiara eating vada pav in Mumbai Metro; fans react
380.article_body: A video of Varun Dhawan and Kiara Advani eating vada pav in a metro in Mumbai while promoting their film 'Jugjugg Jeeyo' went viral on social media. As per Mumbai Metro rules, eating is not allowed inside the metro. "Are eatables allowed inside the...metro?" an Instagram user commented. Another user commented, "Eating isn't allowed...VIP treatment."

381.title: Hyderabad receives rainfall, IMD forecasts more rain till June 18
381.article_body: Rains lashed Hyderabad on Wednesday morning and Kandikal Gate of Bandlaguda Mandal received the highest rainfall at 53.3 mm, as per the Telangana State Development Planning Society. The India Meteorological Department (IMD) has predicted light to moderate rainfall in the city from June 16 to 18. Southwest Monsoon arrived in Hyderabad on Monday.

382.title: Which are the world's top 10 airlines by customer experience?
382.article_body: Qatar Airways is world's best airline, according to Skytrax. It is followed by Singapore Airlines, ANA: All Nippon Airways, Emirates and Japan Airlines. Cathay Pacific has been ranked 6th, followed by EVA Air, Qantas Airways, Hainan Airlines and Air France. The rankings are based on customer survey period from September 2019 to July 2021.

383.title: Great Indian hornbill tortured before being killed in Nagaland; 3 held as video surfaces
383.article_body: A great Indian hornbill was tortured and beaten with a stick before being killed in Nagaland's Wokha district. Police have arrested three people after the video of the incident was widely shared on social media. "It is indeed too cruel and insane to have acted in such a manner and the culprits should be booked," an NGO said.

384.title: I am not really interested in winning a Grammy: BTS member Jungkook
384.article_body: South Korean boy band BTS' member Jungkook said while he knows that winning a Grammy award is a "huge" deal, he is "not really" interested in actually winning one. "I think our status is there whether we win a Grammy or not," added Jungkook. Talking about his voice, Jungkook stated, "There's a lot of times when I don't like it."

385.title: Are we terrorists?: Adhir Ranjan as police detain protesting Cong leaders
385.article_body: As Congress leader Rahul Gandhi appeared for the third day before the Enforcement Directorate (ED) on Wednesday, party workers and leaders protesting against the ED questioning were detained by police outside the AICC office. "Are we terrorists? Why are you scared of us? They are using police force against Congress leaders and workers," Congress leader Adhir Ranjan Chowdhury said.

386.title: Wouldn't have gone anyway: Owaisi on not being invited to Opposition meet
386.article_body: AIMIM chief Asaduddin Owaisi on Wednesday said he wasn't invited to the meeting of Opposition leaders called by TMC chief Mamata Banerjee in Delhi. "Even if I were invited, I wouldn't have participated," Owaisi added, stating Congress to be the reason behind his decision. Notably, Mamata Banerjee had invited leaders of 22 political parties to discuss strategy for Presidential election.

387.title: Risk of US recession probably at 50% now: Morgan Stanley CEO
387.article_body: The risk of a recession in the US is at about 50%, said Morgan Stanley CEO James Gorman. An economic downturn could "fatally damage" some institutions, Gorman said and added that any such decline would likely be short-lived. My focus in more on non-financial risks like data stability, cyber and operations risk, he further said.

388.title: Been told my scripts are 'too much LGBT', don't know what that means: Onir
388.article_body: Filmmaker Onir said that he has been told by platforms that his scripts are 'too much LGBT'. "I don't know what that means," he said, adding, "I am called for Pride webinars...The platforms promise that they will reach out, but I keep sending scripts after the webinar, but don't get any response."

389.title: Telugu subject compulsory for class 1 to 10 in Telangana schools
389.article_body: Telangana government has mandated Telugu as a second language for students of CBSE, ICSE, IB and other board-affiliated schools from Class 1 to 10 starting this academic year. Accordingly, two Telugu textbooks, one for Telugu-speaking students and the other for students whose mother tongue is not Telugu have been designed. Non-compliance with the rule will have repercussions, the circular stated.

390.title: 'Solve dispute in lifetime' approach won’t work with India-China matter: RSS leader
390.article_body: RSS leader Ram Madhav said the approach of 'I should solve this dispute in my lifetime' will not work in the India-China border issue. "Don't be in a hurry for a (Indo-China boundary) solution…It's not going to be solved, because you are not dealing with just any other country, you are dealing with a civilisation, a cultural nation," he added.

391.title: BBMP issues COVID-19 advisories for schools, parents after students test +ve
391.article_body: Bruhat Bengaluru Mahanagara Palike (BBMP) has issued a set of advisories for schools and parents after 31 students tested COVID-19 positive at two schools. In an advisory, BBMP directed schools to mandatorily conduct thermal screening for all students and staff at the entrance. In another advisory issued for parents, BBMP urged all eligible members in the house to get vaccinated.

392.title: Kept taking my chances: Ruturaj Gaikwad on scoring 5 fours in an over
392.article_body: Talking about scoring five fours in an over during the third T20I against South Africa, opener Ruturaj Gaikwad said, "That (Anrich Nortje over) was the fifth over of the powerplay and...we wanted to...get as many runs as possible." "I...kept...taking my chances and didn't think that we have 10 runs in the over already so I should stop," added Ruturaj.

393.title: UN cuts food aid to 17 lakh people in South Sudan amid funding crisis
393.article_body: At least 17 lakh people in South Sudan will lose access to food aid as the UN World Food Programme (WFP) has suspended its assistance citing a shortage of funds. Among those affected are 1.78 lakh children who will no longer receive school meals, WFP said. Over 60% of the country's population faces severe food insecurity, according to the WFP.

394.title: PM greeted with 'Modi, Modi' chants as 50k people gather to see him in Pune
394.article_body: PM Narendra Modi was greeted with chants of 'Modi, Modi', 'Har Har Mahadev' and 'Jai Shree Ram' as he addressed a gathering after inaugurating the Shila temple in Pune's Dehu on Tuesday. Around 50,000 people from Dehu and adjacent villages had gathered to see PM Modi. He inaugurated Sant Tukaram Temple in Dehu.

395.title: 'Agniveers' to get priority in police recruitment in UP: CM Yogi
395.article_body: UP CM Yogi Adityanath on Wednesday said 'Agniveers', soldiers who are recruited in the Army, Navy and the Air Force under the 'Agnipath' scheme, will get priority in recruitment to police and related services in the state. "The double-engine government of BJP is dedicated and committed for...upliftment of...youth," Yogi tweeted. Under the scheme, youngsters will be recruited for four years.

396.title: India's trade deficit in May at record $24.3 bn, exports rise 20.55%
396.article_body: India's merchandise exports in May rose 20.55% to $38.94 billion while the trade deficit rose to a record $24.29 billion, up from $6.53 billion recorded in May 2021, according to government data released on Wednesday.  Imports in May grew 62.83% to $63.22 billion. Cumulative exports and imports between April 2022-May 2023 rose to $78.72 billion and $123.41 billion respectively.

397.title: Video shows Delhi Police entering Congress HQ, police say 'people threw barricades at us'
397.article_body: Congress has shared a video of Delhi Police personnel entering the party's headquarters amid protests over Enforcement Directorate's questioning of Rahul Gandhi. Calling it a "criminal trespass", Congress alleged policemen also thrashed its workers. Delhi Police said that many people threw barricades at the police near the Congress office but denied that policemen entered the office or used force.

398.title: Ruturaj deserves praise as he played with people behind him to take his spot: Jaffer
398.article_body: Ex-India cricketer Wasim Jaffer has said India opener Ruturaj Gaikwad deserves praise for his 57-run innings in the third South Africa T20I as he played "with a lot of people sitting behind him to take his spot". Jaffer added, "You've [got] to praise Gaikwad for the way he batted after not being able to score in the first two matches."

399.title: LinkedIn, UN Women partner to advance women empowerment in India
399.article_body: LinkedIn on Wednesday announced partnership with United Nations Women to advance women's economic empowerment in Asia Pacific, beginning with the state of Maharashtra. The LINK Women Project will begin with a 15-month pilot to cultivate the digital, soft and employability skills of 2,000 women. Women who have completed higher education can participate in the project.

400.title: I did do horrible things throughout my relationship, behaved in horrible ways: Amber
400.article_body: In a new interview since Johnny Depp's defamation trial verdict, Amber Heard said the trial was the most "horrible and humiliating" thing she has been through. "I made a lot of mistakes, but I've always told the truth," she added. "I did do and say horrible...things throughout my relationship. I behaved in horrible...ways. I have so much regret," said Amber.

401.title: 455 booked for drunken driving in Noida, Greater Noida in a day
401.article_body: Over 450 people were booked in a day for drunken driving across Noida and Greater Noida in UP, police said on Wednesday. Vehicles and suspicious-looking people were checked during the process, which led to the police penalising 455 people, 181 people in Noida, 224 in central Noida and 50 in Greater Noida.

402.title: Thieves cut open ATM kiosk in Delhi’s Satya Niketan, steal ₹20 lakh
402.article_body: Some unidentified men reportedly cut open an ATM kiosk using a gas cutter in Southwest Delhi's Satya Niketan and stole ₹20 lakh on early Wednesday. "The accused...used a spray on the lens of CCTV cameras...They then used a gas cutter to weaken the base of the ATM and...cut open the iron chest...which had all the cash," police said.
